loans.name: Ines Margarita

texts.es: Ines  de 46 años vive ( Quevedo Ecuador ). Ella decidió entrara a este negocio para mejorar su situación económica .y ayudar a sus hijos en lo que podía . tiene 8 hijos solo tiene 4 a cargos de ellas es separada . trabaja todos los Dias con mucho esfuerzo y ganas ella y sus hijas la ayudan en lo necesario . la dificultad que tiene es la enfermedad y la delincuencia . a futuro ella anhela tener su casa propia y mejorar su negocio . con el préstamo comprara ( sillas mesas ect).
texts.en: Ines, who is 46 years old, lives in Quevedo, Ecuador. She decided to start this business in order to better her economic situation and help her children in any way that she can. She has 8 children, only 4 of which are in her care, as she is separated. She works every day and puts a lot of effort and will into it. Her daughters help her when needed. The difficulties she faces are sickness and crime rates. In the future, she hopes to have a house of her own and to make her business grow. With this loan, she will buy chairs and tables.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: Wamalwa

texts.en:
Wamalwa is age 48 and married with seven children between the ages of twenty-one and two years. He has been farming for seven years. He runs his farm with the help of one farmhand. He is also involved in a motorcycle transport business. His farm produces milk and vegetables which he sells within the local market.

He has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says he hopes to get enough milk for family consumption as well generate more income from the milk sales to meet other family needs.

Wamalwa says the challenge remains animal diseases and food shortages during dry seasons. However, he remains optimistic with the farming business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, 24 years old and married to Peter, has operated an M-pesa shop (mobile-phone-based money transfer service) for the past two years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000. Now requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to increase her business float, she will use the additional profits earned to open another M-pesa branch.

Janet's dream is to buy a car and a plot of land for her family. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to apply for more float for her business.

loans.name: Geoconda Carolina

texts.es: Geoconda de 19 años vive ( Quevedo Ecuador ) . ella decidió entrar al negocio de la costura porque desde pequeña su padre le enseño. A parte ella estuvo en un curso de corte y confecion . ahora ella se puso su propio taller de costura . trabaja todos los días sola con mucho esfuerzo y ganas es madre soltera  tiene  1 hijo . a futuro anhela tener su negocio mas amplio y darle a su  hijo lo que necesite . con el préstamo comprar ( telas hilos ect ).
texts.en: Geoconda, who is 19 years old, lives in Quevedo, Ecuador. She decided to go into sewing because she was taught by her father since she was a child. She also completed a course in cloth cutting and designing. She now has her own sewing workshop. She works every day, putting a lot of effort and will into it, and is a single mother of one child. In the future, she hopes to make her business grow and to give her child what it needs. With this loan, she will buy various types of cloth and thread.

loans.use: to buy cloth and thread.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Agée de 45 ans, Mariam vit avec ses  deux enfants et son époux dans une famille traditionnelle élargie, à Fakola, un chef lieu d’une commune rurale. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, Mariam s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de poissons séchés et fumés. Elle est très appréciée et sollicitée à Fakola et environs par les restauratrices et ménagères.  
Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, Mariam est à son deuxième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 5 gros paniers de poissons à partir de la république du Sénégal. Elle effectue ses ventes, au comptant et en détail, à domicile, au marché de Fakola et dans les foires environnantes à une clientèle composée essentiellement d’hommes et de femmes. 
Mariam espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mariam is 45 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in a traditional, extended family setting in Fakola, the main town of a rural community. Not having had the opportunity to attend school, Mariam quickly became interested in revenue-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of dried and smoked fish. She is highly regarded and much sought-after in Fakola and the surrounding region by restaurateurs and housewives.

Having correctly repaid her first loan, Mariam is on her second, which will be use to buy 5 large baskets of fish from the Republic of Senegal. She sells her wares for cash or credit, door-to-door and at the markets of Fakola and surrounding communities, to a customer base comprised of men and women. Mariam hopes to make a monthly profit of 200 000 francs which she will use to support her husband with the household needs, repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Nelson Javier

texts.es:
Nelson, un joven de 25 años, el cual vive en la comunidad los Ranchos, en las afueras de la ciudad de León, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de Leña , con este negocio mantiene a su esposa y sus tres hijos.  El inicio a los 17 años con esfuerzo propio pues recorría grandes caminos vendiendo leña y también sandia pues su pobreza no le permitió seguir estudiando solo finalizo la primaria.  
El usara el crédito para comprar 2 llantas y rines nuevos que necesita para su carretón y también para comprar un lote de leña para vender. Uno de sus proyecto que desea realizar es sembrar hortalizas y frutas pues durante esta época la demanda de frutas y hortalizas es muy buena.
texts.en: Nelson, a young man of 25, lives in the village of Los Ranchos, on the outskirts of the city of León. A salesman by trade, he sells firewood; his business supports his wife and their three children. He started when he was 17, with great efforts, since he travelled extensively to sell firewood as well as watermelons. Due to his being poor, he finished only primary school and was not able to continue further. He will use this loan to buy 2 new rims and tires, which he needs for his cart, as well as a stack of firewood to sell. One of the projects he wishes to accomplish is to plant vegetables and fruit, since at this time of year the demand for these products is quite good.

loans.use: to buy 2 new rims and tires, which he needs for his cart, as well as a stack of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Moumine

texts.fr:
Né vers 1974 à Nièssoumana, Moumine vit avec ses 3 enfants et sa femme dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie dans la commune rurale de Fakola. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, Monsieur Moumine s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des animaux (bœufs, chèvres, moutons etc.)  Il est très apprécié et sollicité à Fakola et environs.  
Moumine est à son premier prêt  avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 10 bœufs dans le village de Finiko et environnants. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et en détail, en république de Côte d’Ivoire et dans les foires  de Fakola et Farako à une clientèle composée essentiellement de bouchers, de revendeurs et d’éleveurs. 
Moumine espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 125.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les affaires.
texts.en:
Born around 1974 in Nièssoumana, Moumine lives with his wife and 3 children in a large, traditional family setting in the rural community of Fakola. Not having had the opportunity to go to school, Moumine quickly became engaged in revenue-generating activities, most notably the buying and selling of animals (oxen, goats, sheep, etc.). He is held in high regard and much sought-out in Fakola and the surrounding region.

Moumine is on his first loan with Soro Yiriwaso, which will be used to buy 10 oxen in the village of Finiko and the surrounding area. He makes his sales, for cash or credit, in the Republic of the Ivory Coast and the markets of Fakola and Farako, to a customer base principally composed of butchers, resellers and breeders. Moumine hopes to make a monthly profit of 125 000 francs, which he will use to take care of his family's needs, repay the loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy oxen.

loans.name: Barnaba

texts.en:
Barnas is 65 years old and has been active in farming for six years. He produces and sells poultry and milk to the local market. He also carries out a retail business in the local market to supplement his farming income. He is married with six children, between the ages of 18 and 30.

Barnabas has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. This is his second loan with Juhudi Kilimo, after the first one of the same amount. He says the acquisition of an additional dairy cow will improve the family's milk production and living standards. His goal is to own at least five dairy cows.

Barnabas, however, says farmers are facing great challenge due to animal diseases. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for their loan products.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina works hard to support her family. Celestina is married and has a retail business selling purified drinking water and soft drinks in the Philippines.

Celestina has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more purified water and soft drinks to sell to customers.

Celestina has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Celestina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more purified water and soft drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes works hard to support her family. Agnes is single and has a general store in the Philippines.

Agnes has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as canned goods, detergent and snack foods to sell in her store.

Agnes has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Agnes would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as canned goods, detergent and snack foods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle works hard to support her family. Anabelle is married and has a food business in the Philippines.

Anabelle has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Anabelle has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Anabelle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 42 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ana Marie is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ana Marie has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from electronic loading.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is photographed in his store which he is preparing to open as part of his project. 

Jihad is a twenty-seven-year-old single young man. He is preparing to open a store to sell mobile phones and their accessories to customers. This will be a profitable project as there is high demand for this type of goods. 

Jihad is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help cover the costs of purchasing mobile phones and collections of their accessories. This will enable Jihad to prepare well for the opening of his store and will allow him to offer a wide variety of mobile phones and their accessories for sale. This will help to increase sales and improve Jihad's income and create a bright future for him.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones and their accessories in bulk.

loans.name: Tene

texts.fr:
Agée de 38 ans, TENE vit avec ses  3  enfants et son époux dans une famille nucléaire, à Fakola, un chef lieu d’une commune rurale. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, TENE s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente d’habillements et de pagnes wax. Elle est très appréciée et sollicitée à Fakola et environs
TENE est à son quatrième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 15 pièces de pagnes wax de différentes qualités auprès des grossistes de Kolondièba et de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes, au comptant et en détail, à domicile, au marché de Fakola et dans les foires environnantes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
TENE espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Tene is 38 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in a nuclear family environment, in Fakolo, the principal town of a rural community. Not having had the opportunity to attend school, Tene quickly became engaged in revenue-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of clothing and wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African material). She is highly valued and much sought out in Fakola and the surrounding area.

Tene is on her 4th loan, which will be used to buy 15 pieces of wax pagnes of mixed quality from the wholesalers in Kolondièba and Bamako. She sells her merchandise for cash, door-to-door, at the markets of Fakola and surrounding communities, to a retail clientele made up of men and women. Tene hopes to earn a monthly profit of 75 000 francs, which she will use to help her husband provide for the family, repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 22-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and child. He is trying his best and working hard in order to be able to satisfy his family's needs. After many years of experience in repairing and selling wheels, Ali decided to open his own shop in 2007. Today, he is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase extra products, such as wheels, for his business and to renew his tools, as well. This Kiva loan will boost his business and allow him to attract new customers. In the future, he plans to work as a wheels trader.

loans.use: to purchase extra products, such as wheels, for his business and to renew his tools, as well.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old, young man who is engaged and preparing to be married soon. He is a worker who has a low salary that is not enough to cover his wedding expenses. 

Ali is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new home furnishings such as bedroom, living room, and dinning room furniture to prepare for his wedding . This will provide him suitable home furniture and will help him get his home well-prepared before he gets married. 

Ali is photographed above in his house which he will soon live in with his coming wife.

loans.use: to purchase necessary home furnishings for his wedding.

loans.name: Taha

texts.en:
Taha is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and three siblings, one of whom is working. His father, who has been serving in the Lebanese army, takes care of the family. In order to help him, Taha decided to work independently as a plumber; he has been doing this since 2009. 

Taha is brave and highly professional. Today, he wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional plumbing tools for his new projects. He notes that this will help him carry on his work in a proper way. In the future, he plans to open his own plumbing tools shop.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing tools for new projects.

loans.name: Domel

texts.en:
Domel currently resides in Estefania with his spouse and five children. His primary sources of income are derived from backyard hog raising, farming and his transportation service. He has owned and operated a van transportation service for almost three years. Domel is thankful that his businesses enable him to pay his children's school expenses.

He is now requesting a loan of P14,000 to pay for franchise renewal and maintenance of the van to ensure the continued smooth operation of his transport service and the good income it generates. Someday, with continued effort, patience and faith in God, Domel will achieve a successful life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal and maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Nayef

texts.en:
Nayef is photographed in his store for selling car accessories. He is a 23-year-old single young man, and he lives with his family of 12 members. His mother is a school teacher and his father is not employed.

For the past five years, Nayef has been operating a store for selling car accessories, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him, but which helps to cover his family's costs and needs.

Nayef is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing car accessories in bulk to sell. This will increase sales, especially because his is the only store for selling car accessories in the area where he lives, which will positively lead to improving the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase car accessories in bulk.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario and his spouse have seven children. The youngest is attending school. The rest have finished their education and have settled into marriage. 

Mario and his spouse work untiringly selling fruits and vegetables to the people in the village where they live. The family's vending business generates good income through affordable prices and friendly service. Mario is also known to be humble. 

He is now borrowing a loan of PHP 19,000 to buy cabbages, tomatoes and a sack of rice to sell. He hopes this loan will be granted to him as a way of improving and diversifying the business. 

Mario is praying for good health and a profitable business to achieve financial independence for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes and a sack of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more mobile phones for sale and improve the store's condition

loans.name: Jehan

texts.en:
Jehan is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Khaled appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Jehan is a 27-year-old young woman. She is married to Khaled who is a construction contractor who works with his father and gets a salary, which is not enough to cover all life's costs.

Jehan is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing construction supplies, such as tiles, bleaching and painting, to finish a number of stores he has in order to lease them. This will enable Jehan's husband to improve the stores' condition and have the opportunity to lease them to customers soon, which will increase and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to finish a number of stores he has to lease

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh (pictured working in his office) is a 26 year-old married man who doesn't have children yet.

For the past three years, Hamzeh has operated a business that offers public services like: translating documents, printing and copying materials and papers, and typing. This has been a profitable endeavor and his only source of income.

Hamzeh is requesting a $3,000 youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing computers, a copier and a printing machine in order to improve the quality of his work. This will increase the size of his business and also improve his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase computers, a copier and a printing machine for his business.

loans.name: Sa'dya

texts.en:
Sa'dya is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Sa'dya is a 28-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother with two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a schoolteacher who earns a salary, but not enough to cover all the family's needs and costs.

Sa'dya is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a new computer, which will help him to prepare the necessary and requested reports and exams for his students. This will enable him to improve his work and enhance his skills in using a computer, and help him prepare requested school documents on time.

loans.use: To purchase a computer.

loans.name: Sultonboi

texts.ru: Султонбой женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Имеет семилетний опыт в скотоводстве и занимается купле продажей крупного рогатого скота. Он выращивает и откармливает 6 голов крупного рогатого скота с  телятами. Султонбой по специальности  тракторист и работает на Акционерном Обществе и получает хорошую зарплату. Также он имеет 0,75 соток земли и выращивает кукурузу на корм скота. Султонбой запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью увлечения поголовья скота. Султонбой надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Sultonboi is married and is raising two children. He has seven years of experience in cattle breeding and he is engaged in buying and selling cattle. He raises and fattens six heads of cattle with calves. 

Sultonboi is a tractor-driver by profession, works at the company and receives a good pay. Further he owns 0.75 acres of land and he grows sweet corn to feed the cattle. 

Sultonboi requests a loan for the purchase of cattle, with an aim to increase the cattle heard. He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Muhayokhon

texts.ru: Мухайёхон трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Она замужем и заботливая мать одного ребенка. В настоящее время её муж находится в России на заработках, и она сама содержит свою семью. Она работает бухгалтером в дехканском хозяйстве, её зарплата не хватает ей на покрытые  семейных расходов и дополнительно занимается купле- продажей скота и земледелием. Имеет 2 гектара земли, где выращивает плодовые деревья. На данный момент посеяла кукурузу на корм скоту. В обороте она имеет 6 голов крупного и 8 голов мелкого рогатого скота. С прибыли она купила себе автомашину марки «Тикко» и использует машину для своего бизнеса. Мухайёхон запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений для урожайности земли и покупки скота для увлечения поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Muhayokhon is a hardworking and good woman. She is married and the caring mother of one child. Currently her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation, and she supports the family herself. 

Muhayokhon works as an accountant at the dekhan farm, her salary is not enough to cover the family's expenses, and she is engaged in buying and selling of livestock and agriculture in addition. She owns to acres of land, where she grows fruit trees. Currently she has sown sweet corn as livestock fodder. She owns six heads of cattle and 8 heads of small livestock. For the profit she has bought a car (of the brand Tikko) and she uses this car for her business. 

Muhayokhon requests a loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers for the productivity of the land and the purchase of livestock for increasing the herd.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and livestock

loans.name: Wadea

texts.en:
This is Wadea, 33, a resident of Sana`a, Yemen. He is married and a father of two children. He manages their household while operating his business. He is working hard to continually provide income for his family's everyday expenses. 

Wadea operates a pharmacy. He earns by getting medicines from different companies and selling by the packet. He started his business by working as an employee in a company which enabled him to open his business. He requested a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy medicines for his business.

Wadea hopes to grow his business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give his children a good and high quality education through all his hard work on his business.

loans.use: to buy medicines for his business

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Né vers 1973 à Kolondièba, DAOUDA vit avec ses 8 enfants et sa femme dans une famille traditionnelle à Fakola. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons sociales, Monsieur DAOUDA s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des  céréales mil, riz, maïs, fonio, arachide, etc.  Il est très apprécié et sollicité à Fakola et environs.  
Nanti de 3 années d’expériences dans le domaine, DAOUDA dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son  deuxième prêt, après avoir correctement remboursé le précédent. 
DAOUDA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 tonnes de maïs et 1 tonne de fonio auprès des paysans producteurs  des villages. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et quelques fois à crédit, en république de Côte d’Ivoire et dans la foire de Fakola à une clientèle  diverse et variée.
DAOUDA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les affaires.
texts.en:
Born around 1973 in Kolondièba, Daouda lives with his wife and 8 children in a traditional family environment in Fakola. Unable to attend school for social reasons, Daouda quickly became involved in revenue-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of cereals (millet, rice, fonio, corn, groundnuts, etc.). He is highly valued and sought out in Fakola and the surrounding neighbourhood.

With 3 years experience in his field and on the lookout for additional financial resources, Daouda decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso. He is now on the second loan, having correctly repaid the first. Daouda plans to use the money to buy 5 tonnes of corn and 1 tonne of fonio from the village farmers. He makes his sales, for cash and sometimes credit, in the Republic of the Ivory Coast and at the market of Fakola, to a diverse and varied retail clientele. Daouda hopes to make a monthly profit of 100 000 francs which he will use to provide for his family, repay the loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada lives peacefully at Libag, with her spouse. She has three children. One is working abroad and the rest have their own families and live separately with them. 

Iluminada is thankful for earning profits from her business of hog fattening and breeding. Through her business, she has been able to buy food for daily meals and pay for electric bills. Iluminada has four piglets. She would like to strengthen her business. As of now, she is borrowing PHP 33,000 to buy vaccines, medicines and hog feed. 

Iluminada would like to ensure proper growth of hogs that will lead her to earn good profits from it. With enough funds, she will able to establish a better pigpen for her hogs.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, medicines and hog feed.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is aged 41 and married with seven children, aged between twenty and one year old. He has been in farming in his rural home in Kitale, Western Kenya for over five years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces milk, maize and eggs for the local market. He also runs a motorcycle transport business.

Andrew has requested a loan of 82,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow at 52,000 KES and build a zero grazing unit at 30,000 KES. This is his fourth loan with Juhudi Kilimo after the previous three of 10,000 KES, 45,000 KES and 80,000 KES respectively. He expects to get more returns from farming owing to his experience which runs to five years.

He reiterates that joining Juhudi Kilimo for its loan services has been a great boost to his milk production and income.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and construct a zero-grazing unit

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 23 years old and she is married to Daniel. Together they have two children. She sells second-hand clothes and has been in the business for the past one year.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client.She will use the loan to purchase clothes for sale.

She hopes to open a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: tp purchase stock of used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a jolly person. Despite poverty in life, she still has the determination to succeed. Jesusa has eight children. Two of them attend high school.

Jesusa operates a small variety store in front of her house at Estefania. She would like to acquire more customers and generate good profits from her business. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 19,000 to buy additional items to vend. She will buy canned goods, soft drinks, eggs and three sacks of rice. 

Jesusa would like to make the business more profitable in order to earn funds for the college education of her children. When they earn degrees, they will find good jobs for the welfare of their own lives someday.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, eggs and three sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a hardworking and loving husband. He is 26 years old and has one child. His wife spends full time in nursing their child. 

To earn an income, Jonathan sells beef and pork. He buys the meat at the public market and resells it at their village for profit. He has been doing this for two years now and earns PHP 3,000 each month.

He is now borrowing PHP 7,000 to buy more beef and pork meat to resell. He would like to continue operating this business and earn good profits for the sustenance of the family. In the future, he will also established a hog-raising business for an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy more beef and pork to resell.

loans.name: Felymar

texts.en:
Felymar is 56 years old, married and has three children. Her spouse works as a company driver. 

To augment her spouse's income, Felymar uses her skills in sewing curtains and uniforms. Aside from this business, she is also a Barangay (smallest unit of town) secretary at Estefania. She is happy to serve other people and at the same time generate income from her small business. 

As of now, one of her children still attends school and Felymar wants to give her the best education. Felymar needs her business to improve in order to acquire more profits from it. She is asking for PHP 28,000 to buy fabric, threads and needles to use in her sewing services. She hopes to satisfy all her customers with good output from the sewing services and make it more profitable than before. 

Felymar will be very happy if her children have good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads and needles to use in her sewing services.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina resides at Libag Sur with her spouse and four children. She has sent all her children to school and now they have their own employment. She is happy that they helped her financially in times of need. 

Catalina doesn't want to rely on their remittances, so she patiently generates an income from her hog-raising business. She usually earns about PHP 2,500 for each hog she is able to dispose. This goes for meals and bills at home.
 
Catalina would like to earn a better profit from the business so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for the hogs. She hopes to make her pigs grow healthier to offer them at a better price. If she achieves this, the income will be saved for future expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for the hogs.

loans.name: Khadeja

texts.en:
Khadeja is photographed in her store where she sells clothes. She is a 31-year-old young woman, married with no children yet. Her husband is employed with a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's costs.

For the past three years, Khadeja has been running a store selling clothes, which has a good reputation among customers and is located in a good  area, which makes her project a profitable one.

Khadeja is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing clothes in bulk for the coming summer season. This will offer Khadeja a new selection of summer clothes, which will enable her to compete with others well, increase her sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk for the coming summer season

loans.name: Muniratu

texts.en:
Muniratu cooks food to sell at a village called Ayensudu near Elmina. Some of the foods she cooks are "banku" (fermented maize dough), "wakye" (beans and rice), and plain rice with tomato sauce, spicy black pepper, etc. Given the loan, she will acquire additional tomatoes, beans and rice to enable her to cook in large quantities for resale. 

Munirato is presently living with four dependents and as a responsible parent she assists her spouse to provide the daily needs of her family. Any profit accruing from her increased income will be used to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to acquire additional tomatoes, beans and rice to enable her to cook in large quantities for resale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married with three children. She operates a chop bar (a place where people are served varieties of food). She prepares "fufu" which is made from cassava and "banku" from corn and serves them with different types of soups, for example groundnut soup or peanut butter soup and others. She will be using the loan to purchase cassava, tomatoes, corn and other ingredients that will enable her to cook food for sale. The new profit will be reinvested into the food business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava, tomatoes, corn and other ingredients that will enable her to cook food for sale.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Agée de 46 ans, Salimata vit avec ses  5  enfants et son époux dans une famille traditionnelle, à Fakola, un chef lieu d’une commune rurale. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, Salimata s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente d’habillements et de pagnes wax. Elle est très appréciée et sollicitée à Fakola et environs
Salimata est à son premier prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 15 pièces de pagnes wax de différentes qualités auprès des grossistes de Kolondièba et de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes, au comptant et en détail, à domicile, au marché de Fakola et dans les foires environnantes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Salimata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Salimata is 46 years old and lives with her spouse and 5 children in a traditional family setting in Fakola, the main town of a rural community. Not having had the opportunity to attend school, Salimata quickly became engaged in revenue-generating activities, namely the buying and selling of clothes and wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing). She is highly valued and much sought out in Fakola and the surrounding area.

Salimata is on her first loan which will be used to buy 15 pieces of wax pagnes of varied quality from the wholesalers in Kolondièba and Bamako. She sells her merchandise for cash, door-to-door and at the markets of Fakola and neighbouring communities, to a retail clientele composed of men and women. Salimata hopes to make a monthly profit of 75 000 francs, which she will use to help her husband provide for the family's needs, repay the loan and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Ameeda Moro

texts.en: Ameeda fries doughnuts to sell at a nearby school at Ayensudu near Elmina in the Central Region of Ghana. She serves the doughnuts with locally made drinks like ginger drink, millet drink and others. She is married. Her loan will be used to buy more items to enable her to increase her sales. The new profit realized will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more items to enable her to increase her sales.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente, a 52-year-old resident of Estefania, is a rice retailer who is married and has five children. 

Vicente is a hardworking father. Aside from his farming business, he also vends rice to the people in his village and acquires profits from it. He usually acquires PHP 2,000 for each sack of rice he sells. He has been doing this for almost five years. His income goes for school expenses for the two of his children who are currently attending school.

To increase his income, he needs to sell more rice. Therefore, he is now borrowing a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy four sacks of rice to sell. He hopes to make his business more profitable so that he can continue to educate his children. 

Vicente will be very happy and proud if his children finish their education and have stable jobs someday.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ayishatu

texts.en: Ayishatu lives with her four children at Ayensudu, a village near Elmina. She sells products such as doughnuts, chips, pies, and local drinks. She needs a loan from Kiva to expand her food business. Her loan will be used to purchase flour, oil, sugar, flavoring and others for resale. She hopes to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase flour, oil, sugar, flavoring and others for resale.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is divorced and has five dependents. She sells different kinds of fruit (oranges, bananas, pineapple and others) at Ayensudu near Elmina in the Central Region of Ghana. She hopes to use the loan to acquire more fruit to sell. Her profit will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: to acquire more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Khadeja

texts.en:
Khadeja is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Ma'moon appears in her Kiva profile photo, photographed inside the family house while making repairs to it.

Khadeja is a 31-year-old woman, a mother with three sons and two daughters. Her husband is employed and gets a salary, but not enough to cover all the family's needs and pay the costs of repairing the house.

Khadeja is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of repairing and improving the house's condition such as: painting, changing windows and doors, fixing or changing the electric extensions. This will improve the house's condition and create for Khadeja and her family suitable and healthy home conditions.

loans.use: To repair the family house

loans.name: Trifilo

texts.en:
Trifilo is an industrious and simple man who is married to Pacita. The couple has been blessed with four grown-up children. All his children have settled in marriage and have their own families.

Trifilo has been running his livestock business for eight years up to the present. He aims to improve the growth of his raised hogs because he would like to earn a bigger income.With his eagerness to obtain his goal in life and business, he is asking for bigger capital amounting to 15,000 PHP. This amount of loan will be used to buy stock feed and vaccines to maintain the growth of his raised piglets.

Trifilo will be glad if his business is supported by all Kiva lenders continually.

loans.use: to buy stock feed and vaccines to maintain the growth of his raised piglets

loans.name: Hosea

texts.en:
Hosea is 41 years old. He is from Nakuru and is married to Anne. They have two children who are 15 and 8 years old.

Hosea has a poultry business that he has been doing for the past 18 years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd., to enable him buy more chicken to add to his stock. He is optimistic that his business will do well.

He hopes to expand his business and be a wholesale supplier of chicken to big hotels and institutions.

loans.use: To buy more chicken to raise and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a business woman. She does welding to earn a living. She has been in the business for 8 years and has employed 2 people. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. She describes her customers as loyal because they visit her regularly.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
At present, Wilfredo is raising four piglets and it’s been five years of patience and sacrifices he has had devote to make this business profitable. He is really thankful because through his livestock business, he is able to support his family and send his children to school. 

Wilfredo would like to educate his three children, for it is the only thing that he can give to his three children. He hopes that his children can finish their degree courses so that they can find better opportunities after pursuing their courses. 

With regard to his main goal, he would like to take out a loan amounting to P15,000 which will be used to buy feed supplies for his hogs to make them healthy and bigger until they reach their optimum growth. He is hoping for continuing financial support from the lenders, to be able to have a better way of living and obtain higher income to cover his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock business

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 35 years old, married and has four children attending school. 

To make a living, she and her spouse are both involved in making pancit miki (colorful noodles made from flour) to sell. They offer their products at the public market and the nearby villages. Valentina is thankful for the kind of business she has though she generates only minimal income from it. She wants to increase her sales, so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy flour, cooking oil and food coloring to use in making pancit miki. 

She hopes to develop her business and continue growing as an entrepreneur. She believes that someday, the family will achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and food coloring to use in making pancit miki.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for insurance and the purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Alexandrina

texts.en:
Alexandrina is widowed. She has two children. One is still attending school.

Alexandrina has been selling rice and livestock feed to the people in her village for three years now. She usually makes about PHP 5,000 each month. Her income goes for meals, the allowances of her children and bills at home.
 
Alexandrina would like to improve her sales so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy a sack of rice and livestock feed to sell. She hopes to acquire a good income from the business that will someday lead her to financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice and livestock feed to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a business man. He does a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for 7 years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. To earn extra income, he runs a green grocery store.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business and hopes to buy another motorbike in the future. He has applied for 90,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Annbell

texts.en:
Annbell is 31 years old. She sells decorations such as curios and carvings to earn a living. She has been in the business for 2 years and has employed three people. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy decorations to sell.

loans.use: to buy decorations to sell

loans.name: Siaka

texts.fr:
Né vers 1973 à Fakola, Siaka vit avec ses 13 enfants et sa femme dans une famille monogame, à Fakola. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons sociales, Monsieur Siaka s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des  céréales mil, riz, maïs, fonio etc.  Il est très apprécié et sollicité à Fakola et environs.  
Nanti de 5 années d’expériences dans le domaine, Siaka dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son  quatrième prêt, après avoir correctement remboursé les trois précédents. 
Siaka compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 4 tonnes de maïs et 1 tonne de riz auprès des paysans producteurs  des villages et  des grossistes de Bamako. Il effectue ses ventes, au comptant en détail et quelques fois à crédit, en république de Côte d’Ivoire et dans la foire de Fakola à une clientèle  diverse et variée.
Siaka espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
Siaka ambitionne de devenir un grossiste  céréalier à Fakola.
texts.en:
Born around 1973 in Fakola, Siaka lives with his wife and 13 children in a monogamous family environment, in Fakola. He did not have the opportunity to go to school for social reasons, and quickly became engaged in revenue-generating activities, namely the buying and selling of cereals (millet, rice, corn, fonio, etc.). He is highly regarded and sought out in Fakola and the surrounding region.

With 5 years experience in his field and searching for complementary financial resources, Siaka decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his 4th loan with the institution, having correctly repaid the 3 previous ones. Siaka plans to use his loan to buy 4 tonnes of corn and 1 tonne of rice from the village farmers and the wholesalers in Bamako. 

Siaka makes his sales for cash and occasionally credit, in the Republic of the Ivory Coast and at the market of Fakola, to a divers and varied retail clientele. He hopes to make a monthly profit of 100 000 francs, which he will use to take care of his family's needs, repay his loan and reinvest in his business. Siaka aspires to become a cereal wholesaler in Fakola.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is 29 years old and married to Amos. She has an M-pesa shop, a business she has been doing for the past three years, and she earns a monthly income of KES 24,000. 


She wants to apply for more  business float  (virtual currency) and therefore has requested a loan of KES 30,000. 


The profit from this business would help her open another M-pesa branch. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and build rental houses. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more  "float" (virtual currency) for her money-transfer business.

loans.name: Lope

texts.en:
During ten years of involvement in the livestock business, Lope has been able to support his family. He is now 49 years of age and married to Norma who is a vegetable vendor. The couple were blessed with five children; two of them are married,  two others are laborers, and the youngest is still studying.

Nowadays, Lope is raising four piglets, and he is happy to see that his business has improvement through the financial support given to him by the lenders. He already paid back his previous loan and has asked for another loan in the amount of P22,000 which will be used to buy 20 bags of feed and vaccines for the good health of his hogs. 

Lope would like to educate his youngest child, because he doesn’t want to have that child experience what he has during his youth. So despite the hardship he has encountered in running the business, he endures all those things. He hopes that he can improve his business and make it more profitable so that he can continue to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of feed and vaccine for the good nutrition of his hogs

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en:
Jerusha is 52 years old. She is married to Zablon. Together they have three children. She sells second-hand bags and has been in the business for the past 20 years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET by a client. She will use the loan to purchase one bale of used handbags for resale.

She hopes to start selling new bags in the near future.

loans.use: Purchase a  bale of second-hand bags for resale.

loans.name: Bayandelger

texts.en:
Bayandelger is a 30-year-old married man who operates a clothing retail stall at a local indoor market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Aside from his business at the market, he works as an excavator specialist at Hera Investment Co., Ltd., a company that supplies heavy machinery and equipment. 

As Bayandelger is often called out of town, his wife runs their clothing business. They sell women’s clothing imported from Beijing, China. 

Bayandelger is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase more clothing for this spring. He is a trusted client of Transcapital Company, Ltd., this is his third time on Kva, and he always pays his loans successfully and on time. His goal is to own new apartment for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Josefa Aracely

texts.es: Josefa de 47 año vive ( Portoviejo ECUADOR ) . ella decidió entrar al negocio de intalar una tienda en su vivienda para poder cuidar de sus hijos ya que son pequeños . ella pudo poner la tienda gracias a un préstamo que le hizo un provedor logro ponerla y le va bien. Trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos. A futuro ella anhela tener un carro y ampliar su vivienda . con el préstamo comprara (arroz, enlatados, bebidas, granos, viveres varios).
texts.en:
Josefa, 47, lives in Portoviejo, Ecuador.  She decided to go into the business of setting up a store in her home to be able to care for her children, because they are young.  She managed to install the store thanks to a loan from a backer, and it is going well for her.  She works every day with the help of her children.  In the future she wants to have a car and expand her house.

With the loan she will buy rice, canned goods, beverages, grains, and various supplies.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods, beverages, grains, and various supplies.

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
Agée de 18 ans, DJENEBA n’a pas d’enfant et vit avec son mari dans une famille monogame à Fakola. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons sociales, DJENEBA s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des  céréales mil, riz, maïs, fonio etc.  Elle est très appréciée et sollicitée à Fakola et environs.  
DJENEBA dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son  premier prêt. 
DJENEBA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 tonnes de maïs et 2 tonnes de fonio auprès des paysans producteurs des villages. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et quelques fois à crédit, en république de Côte d’Ivoire et dans la foire de Fakola à une clientèle  diverse et variée.
DJENEBA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les affaires.
texts.en:
Eighteen years old, Djeneba has no children and lives with her husband in a monogamous family in Fakota.

Not having had the chance to go to school due to social reasons, Djeneba quickly became interested in income generating businesses notably buying and selling the cereals mil, rice, corn, fonio, etc. She is very much appreciated and in demand in Fakola and surrounding areas.

In researching complementary financial resources, Djeneba decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso with whom she is on her first loan.

Djeneba plans to use her loan to buy 3 tons of corn and 2 tons of fonio from producing farmers in the villages. She sells retail for cash and sometimes for credit, in the republic of the Ivory Coast and at the Fakola fair to a diverse and varied clientèle. 

Djeneba hopes to make a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA which will be used to meet the needs of the family, repay the loan and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a married man, aged 35 years old, and a father of four children between eight and one year old.  Josphat owns a cereals business, which has been in operation for a period of 15 years, earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000.

He has applied for his second loan of KES. 40,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use the money to purchase 30 bags of dry maize at 40,000 KES for sale.The profits will be ploughed back into the business and used to repay the loan.

His dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase 30 bags of dry maize for resale

loans.name: Lina Leonor

texts.es:
La Señora. Lina es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la belleza de su Centro Histórico, tienen una gran riqueza natural, esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Lina tiene 37 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 15, 11 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Lina se dedica a la venta de frutas actividad que la desempeña hace 8 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para su negocio.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Lina is a member of La Paz Communal Bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, which has been a World Heritage Site since December 1999 because of the beauty of its historic center.  It has great natural resources, and the people there preserve the culture and traditions of their communities.

Lina, 37, is married and has three children from this relationship, ages 15, 11, and 8.  Her oldest child studies in high school and the two others in a school in the city.  Her husband works as a private employee.  They do not have their own house so they rent.

Lina works selling fruit, a job she has held for eight years.  She works Monday through Saturday without a fixed schedule.

She has been with the communal bank for five years, and she is going to invest her new loan in buying fruit for her business.

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Teresa Concepción

texts.es:
La Señora. Teresa es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la belleza de su Centro Histórico, tienen una gran riqueza natural, esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Teresa tiene 52 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 4 hijos, 3 son casados  y viven independientes, su último hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Teresa tiene una tienda de comestibles, también tiene un puesto donde vende todo tipo de frutas,  se dedica a estas  actividades desde hace 22 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Por las  tardes también se dedica a la venta de chuzos (carne en palito).
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 14 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una nueva carreta para vender los chuzos.
 
Su sueño es comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the La Paz Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which was named a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1999 for the beauty of its historic centre. It has great natural beauty and is bathed by 4 rivers. The people in Cuenca maintain their culture and the traditions of their towns.

Teresa, 52, lives with her common-law husband and they have 4 children. Of the children, 3 are married and live independently, while their youngest son is studying at the school in the city. Her husband works in commerce. They don’t own their own house and so, have to rent.

Teresa runs a grocery store and has a fruit stand. She’s had these businesses for 22 years and works Sunday to Sunday, 8am to 8pm. In the evenings she also sells chuzos (meat on a stick).

She’s been a member of the Communal Bank for 14 years. With this new loan, she will buy a new cart from which she can sell her chuzos.

She dreams of buying a house.

loans.use: buy a cart.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 55 years old and married with three children. She does tea and livestock farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and has employed two people. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy fertilizer and two cows.

loans.use: To buy  fertilizer and two cows

loans.name: Nina

texts.es: La Sra. Nina  tiene 33 años, no es casada pero convive con su pareja no tienen hijos por el momento, ella se dedica a la  confección de enaguas su taller se encuentra ubicado de la  zona Ferro Petrol,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Nina utilizara este préstamo para compra de telas la para la confección de enaguas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es el  crecimiento en su negocio. La Sra. Nina  enfrenta retos en su negocio que es el de ampliar su mercado, y  utilizara los beneficios en el crecimiento de producción, la Sra. Nina tiene un deseo que es el de ampliar su taller y poder contratar mano de obra para enseñar a otras personas el oficio, Se siente agradecida por al oportunidad que le brinda la institución.
texts.en: Nina is 33 years old and not married, but lives with her partner.  They have no children at the moment.  She makes petticoats in a workshop located in the Ferro Petrol zone.  This will her first loan through the institution.  Nina will use the money to buy fabric to make petticoats.  She is asking for this loan in order to grow her business.  Nina has challenges, that is, she needs to expand her market in order to help her grow.  She wants to expand her workshop and hire employees and teach others the trade.  She is grateful for the opportunity through this institution.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Tserenchimeg

texts.en:
Tserenchimeg, age 38, runs a clothing retail business at a local indoor market in Ulaanbaatar. 

Tserenchimeg usually sells women’s clothing imported from China, and this loan will help her to increase her product variety. She and her husband have two small children, ages 5 and 6. The family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Tserenchimeg is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to import more clothes for the spring, a very high shopping season. She is planning to expand her business by increasing her product variety.

loans.use: to import more clothes for the spring shopping season

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Bayarsaikhan, age 42, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She operates a clothing retail stall at a local indoor market and has made great progress in one and a half years of operation.

Bayarsaikhan has fifteen years of experience in the clothing retail business as she used to operate a retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, until 2007. Bayarsaikhan started her current business after working in Korea for three years. 

Bayarsaikhan has three children: her 23-year-old son works as a machinist at a local company and her 14- and 19-year-old children attend local university and high school. Her husband operates a small business in town. Bayarsaikhan is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes for the upcoming season. Bayarsaikhan is a responsible and very neat person who is intent on improving her family’s living standards and helping her children to become highly educated people in the future. She is also a trusted client of Transcapital Co Ltd.,

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Edemar

texts.en:
Edemar is involved in the agricultural business particularly in livestock raising. He is thankful because his previous loan really help him in obtaining his goal in life. Edemar would like to have continuous access to financial services to improve his livestock business.

Over ten years of hard work and patience, Edemar has able to increase his income which servse to sustain their family. As an additional source of income, his wife Beatriz also engages in the farming business to help her husband in providing their basic necessities.

Edemar would like to take out a loan, in the amount of P15,000 which will be used for buying livestock feed and vaccines to improve the growth of his piglets. He believes that the result of his labor will give him a fruitful outcome that will lead to his success in life.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and vaccines for piglets

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 39 years old and is married with four children. He does welding to earn a living. He has been in the business for five years and has employed four people. To earn extra income he does farming. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his children and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine

loans.name: Ototo

texts.en: Ototo is 38 years old and is married with two children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for 11 years and has employed two people. To earn extra income, he runs a grocery store. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Dedemus

texts.en:
Dedemus is a 56-year-old farmer and married to Maria, a 36-year-old lady. They are blessed with five children: Febi, 20,  studying at a university in Jakarta; Desi, 18, studying in the 2nd grade of Senior High School; Gusti, 17; Noven, 14, studying in the 6th grade of Elementary School; and Mersy, 9, studying in the 2nd grade of Elementary School. 

To make a living, Dedemus cultivates water spinach, string beans and mustard greens at his farm. In addition, Dedemus and his wife sell different kinds of treats such fried banana, ‘nagasari’ (rice-flour cake stuffed with banana slices inside and wrapped in banana leaves), fried cassava, etc. 

The limitation of income generated from the business led Dedemus to work hard to finance his children’s educational fees and daily needs. Therefore he is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,000,000 from TLM to enlarge his businesses. He would like to buy more ingredients to sell more treats and also to buy seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to sell more treats and also to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto Carlos es un emprendedor que tiene 39 años de edad, su negocio al que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general, su actividad la realiza de forma ambulante visita a sus clientes en las empresas y sus casa de habitación para ofrecerle su producto. Roberto Carlo tiene tres hijos y cada día lucha por brindarle lo mejor, su mayor sueño es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y crecer en negocio. Este emprendedor está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos como pantalones, camisas, blúmer, sandalias, zapatos, y otros productos que demandan
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos is a 39 year old entrepreneur.  His business that he works in is the sale of general merchandise.  He carries out his business as a traveling vendor. He visits his clients in companies and their homes to offer them his product.  

Roberto Carlos has three children and fights each day to give them the best. His biggest dream is that his children finish their studies and grow in business.  This entrepreneur is requesting financing to buy more products like pants, shirts, underwear, sandals, shoes and other products in demand.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, underwear, sandals, shoes and other products in demand.

loans.name: Carlos Gonzalo

texts.es: Carlos  vive ( paraíso ecuador) . el vivía en el centro pero se dio la oportunidad de vivir en flor de bastion . e tomo la desicion de  ponerse su propia panadería y fue progresando . el trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano. A futuro el anhela tener otra sucursal y enseñarle a su hijo la profecion de ser panadero. Con el préstamo comprara ( productos de panadería).
texts.en: Carlos lives in Paraíso, Ecuador.  He lived in the city center, but the opportunity was given to him to live in Flor de Bastión.  He made the decision to start his own bakery and has been progressing.  He works every day from very early.  In the future he longs to have another branch and teach his son the profession of being a baker.  With the loan he will buy bakery products.

loans.use: to buy bakery products

loans.name: Ham

texts.en:
Ham, is a 46-year-old man and married to Marita, 27 years old. Ham and Marita are blessed with two children: Aurelia, 8, attending the 3rd grade of Elementary School and Adrian, 11 months old. 

Ham owns a repair shop which is located next to his house. Ham usually runs the business from 8 am to 6 pm. He has received a loan before from TLM and has a good record.  The loan was very helpful for him in improving the business. 

Now Ham is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 4,000,000. The loan will be used to restock spare parts such spark plugs, ball-bearings, gear wheels, brake-oil, lubricants, etc.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts such spark plugs, ball-bearings, gear wheels, brake-oil, lubricants, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 67 años, y tiene la alegría y el espíritu de una joven de 20 años; con esfuerzo ha criado y sacado adelante sola a sus 4 hijos. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica,  ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país, el cual es la “Laguna de Huacachina”, asimismo otro de sus atractivos turísticos es la famosa “bruja de Cachiche”, la cual es visitada por infinidad de turistas en cualquier época del año.  Como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello su platillo favorito es el riquísimo “Tallarín con papa a la Huancaína”; debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar para ser profesora.

Rosa se levanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio de venta de abarrotes, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque vende productos de buena calidad y trata muy bien a los clientes y sobre todo a un buen precio.

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar andamios para exhibir sus productos y mercadería para su negocio; así ella tendrá su negocio con mayor orden y limpieza y además podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando día a día para poder realizar su más grande sueño:” Tener tienda Comercial”.
texts.en:
Rosa is 67 years old, but has the joy and spirit of a young, 20 year old. With much effort, she raised 4 children and helped them get ahead in life, all on her own. Her house is in the city of Ica, well-known for for having the most important tourist attractions in the country, like the Huacachina Lagoon and the Witch of Cachiche, which are visited by an infinite number of tourists at any time of the year. Like a good Peruvian, she likes typical Peruvian food and counts “noodles with potatoes from Huancayo” (noodles with boiled and sliced potatoes with a spicy cheese sauce) as her favorite.
Her parents weren’t financially stable, so she has only a high school education, but she would have enjoyed studying to be a teacher.

Rosa wakes up early every day to sell her grocery items and works about 10 hours a day, attending up to 30 customers in a day. She believes her business is going well because she sells good quality products, treats her customers well and has good prices.

Rosa is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she’ll be able to buy shelving to exhibit her products and merchandise. This will also help her keep her business organized and clean and she’ll be able to offer more variety of products to her customers, which will allow her to continue fighting every day to achieve her biggest dream: to open a supermarket.

loans.use: buy shelving and merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca, habita en la ciudad de León, dueña de una pulpería,  madre de dos hijos de 12 y 4 años de edad respectivamente .Su negocio lo empezó hace 5 años cuando solo vendía bolsas plástica y caramelos su esposo le fue ayudando a comprar más productos para que ofreciera variedad com muy poca mercadería que vendía fue formando su pulpería la cual tiene más productos que antes y sobre todo que la mayoría de sus clientes siempre están satisfecho pues encuentran lo que buscan y trata d darles una buena atención. Siempre mantiene sus planes de ir ampliando su venta, comprar nuevos productos para vender y que sean de mucha necesidad en su barrio. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar vitrinas  para mostrar sus productos y comprar granos básicos, aceite, productos de limpieza. Pues entre más productos venda mejor será la ganancia que le permitirá a su negocio seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Blanca lives in the city of León, owns a grocery store and is the mother of two children, 12 and 4, respectively.
She started her business 5 years ago when she only sold plastic bags and candy. Her husband helped her buy more products to offer more variety, and with the few things she sold she started forming her store. Now, her store has many more products than before and her customers are always happy because she attends to them well and they find everything they need.
She always maintains her plan to expand her business and buy new products that are in demand in her neighborhood. 
She is requesting a loan to buy showcases to exhibit her products, basic grains, oil and cleaning products. If she can sell more products, she’ll generate more income that will help her business grow.

loans.use: buy showcases to exhibit her products, basic grains, oil and cleaning products.

loans.name: Maria Deysi

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 54 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo a su cargo. Vive en casa propia junto con su esposo e hijo, en el Caserío Pingolita, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en la parte rural del distrito y no cuenta con servicios básicos.
La actividad que desarrolla María es la crianza de ganado vacuno, el cual le produce leche fresca para su venta diaria en su domicilio. Complementariamente se dedica a la agricultura, apoyada por su esposo y su hijo, tiene limón en producción el cual cosecha semanalmente y comercializa en el mercado local.
El monto del crédito asciende a 1200 nuevos soles, los cuales serán invertidos en la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado y también para la compra de fertilizantes y úrea para sus cultivos de limón.
texts.en:
María is a 54 year old woman, is married and has one son in her charge. She lives in her own house with her husband and son, in the Caserío Pingolita, in the district of Tambogrande.  She lives in the rural part of the district and doesn't have basic services.

The business that Maria carries out is the rearing of cattle, which produces fresh milk for her daily sales in her home. Additionally, she works in agriculture, supported by her husband and her son.  She has lemon in production, which she harvests weekly and sells in the local market.

The total loan is 1200 nuevos soles, which will be invested to buy balanced feed for her cattle and also to buy fertilizers and urea for her lemon farming.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her cattle and fertilizers for her farming.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is full of hope in obtaining success in life. She is 48 years of age and a widow. Since her husband died, she has had to take the responsibilities of being the father and mother to her three children. According to Gemma, it's really quite hard to be the bread winner of the family, but she didn't have any choice. So she patiently cares for her family at the same time she runs her specialized retail business. In this way, she can meet the welfare of her children. Two of her children have finished their degree courses, while the youngest is still a high school student who requires Gemma's income due to the school fees and daily allowances. 

For now, Gemma would like to ask for additional capital amounting to 10,000 PHP, allowing her to buy more tilapia to be sold within her local community to double her income. She hopes that she can make her business viable as a source of income for the family. That way, she will no longer have the problem of the daily allowances of her child and be able to send her child to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to buy more tilapia for her retail business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new engine for the taxi.

loans.name: Donis Luis

texts.es: Donis, habitante de la ciudad de León, nos expresa que su primera experiencia fue muy positiva para el, pues utilizo el crédito para comprar accesorios para celular ,video juegos para play station. Sus ventas aumentaron se dio a conocer mas como comerciante. Ahora quiere seguir avanzando el necesita una computadora para trabajar es por ello que solicita el crédito para comprar una computadora nueva con sus accesorios.  EL desea ir comprando maquinas nuevas para alquilar y dejar de usar televisores, su objetivo es hacer crecer y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Donis, who lives in the city of Leon, tells us that his first experience was very positive for him, as he used the loan to buy cell phone accessories and PlayStation video games. His sales increased, and he made more of a name for himself as a business owner. 

Now he wants to continue moving forward. He needs a computer for work, and this is why he is applying for the loan to buy a new computer with its accessories. He wishes to gradually buy new machines to rent, and to stop using televisions. His aim is to improve his business and make it grow.

loans.use: To buy a new computer with its accessories.

loans.name: Danelia

texts.es: Danelia tiene 55 años de edad, ella se dedica a brindar los servicios de transporte comercial ya tiene años en el negocio, la emprendedora tiene cinco hijos ya están todos mayores y la ayudan en el negocio y además económicamente. Esta es la primera vez que está solicitando financiamiento para invertir  en el negocio en la compra de llantas para el vehículo y poder ofrecerle a los clientes un buen servicio.
texts.en: Danelia is 55 and has provided a commercial transportation service for several years. This entrepreneur has five children, all of whom are grown and help her with her business as well as financially. This is the first time that Daniela has requested a loan to invest in her business. She will invest in the purchase of tires for her vehicle so that she can offer a good service to her clients.

loans.use: to buy tires for her vehicle.

loans.name: Saruul

texts.en: Saruul is a 49-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 2 sons in Bayanhongor province in Southern Mongolia. Her husband makes construction decoration in the summertime. Saruul has been running a meat retailing business since 1998. She has reliable suppliers who sell her fresh meats. She trades the meats at the trade center. The business has been successful and she has been improving the household alone in the wintertime. Saruul is a responsible and good-natured woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by buying the supplies in large quantities." The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy more meats at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy more meats at wholesale prices

loans.name: Grupo Lucero Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama "Grupo Lucero" y se encuentra ubicado en la localidad de Santa MAría Citendeje, que es una localidad con mucha vegetación, las integrantes de este grupo son personas muy trabajadoras y optimistas, ellas le pusieron este nombre a su grupo ya que les gustan mucho las estrellas y en particular los luceros, pues ellas creen que son muy bellos, ese fue el motivo por el cual decidieron nombrarlo de esta manera, el grupo lo conforman 4 mujeres muy entusiastas, cuyas actividades son las siguientes:
1.- Dinora S. (COMPRA DE NARANJA, JITOMATE, TOMATE, CEBOLLAS, DULCES, ETC. PARA VENDER Y COMPRA DE COSMETICOS PARA VENDER)
2.- Carmen Leticia X. (COMPRA DE REFRESCOS, HUEVO, LACTEOS, DULCES, ACEITE, LECHE, ETC. PARA VENDER.)
3.- Teresa T. (COMPRA DE SABANAS, COLCHAS, ZAPATOS, COSMETICOS, LABIALES, RIMEL, PERFUMES PARA VENDER)
4.- Rosaura S. (COMPRA DE PERFUMES, LABIALES, SOMBRAS, DELINEADORES, BRASIER, PANTALETAS, ZAPATOS, ETC. PARA VENDER.)
Dinora es la representante de este grupo, ella tiene 32 años de edad y está casada desde hace 8 años, ella y su esposo tienen 2 hijo de edades de 7 y 5 años, la señora Dinora solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en su recaudería y en venta de cosméticos, en este tipo de actividades ella tiene 5 años de experiencia en los que ella ha invertido gran parte de su tiempo en esta actividad productiva que es gran ayuda en la economía de su familia, ella no ha tenido problemas mayores que le impidan realizar su trabajo, ella inició este negocio por iniciativa propia porque quería ayudarle a su esposo que es taxista con los gastos de su casa. Un préstamo le ayudará a que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
This group is called "Grupo Lucero" ["Bright Star Group"] and is located in the town of Santa María Citendeje. This is an area with a lot of vegetation. The group members are very hard-working and optimistic. They gave their group this name because they love stars, especially bright stars, and think that they are very beautiful.The group is made up of four very enthusiastic women whose businesses are the following:
