Su sueño es tener un local en el Centro, aunque sea pequeño, para ya no andar vendiendo ambulantemente y asi llevar una vida mas tranquila ya que tiene Diabetes y aunque esta en tratamiento medico en cada vez que llega a su casa luego de haber terminado su jornada laboral diaria se siente resentida de salud. 

El prestamo que Alejandrina solicita lo necesita para comprar maiz, queso, azucar, manteca, entre otros productos, para la elaboracion de las rosquillas y quesadillas. Con el apoyo de este financiamiento ella podra obtener ganacias y cubrir sus gastos medicos y tambien ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su hogar, ya que él se dedica a la agricultura y sus ingresos son pocos. Tambien desea hacerle una mejoras a su casa.

Alejandrina tiene varios años de recibir el apoyo de FAMA a traves del otorgamiento de prestamos que ha cancelado puntualmente y que le han ayudado a mantener su negocio activo y ha mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a merchant.  She has two daughters and five sons.  She is married, and she lives in the La Concepcion village in the Juticalpa municipality.

Alejandrina has been making and selling doughnuts and quesadillas for more than 15 years. She learned this trade because she worked with a neighbor making the same products.  She also learned thanks to several bakery courses she took at the Instituto Nacional de Formacion Profesional (INFOP). 

Her business is located in her home, and still has no name. Her work schedule starts at 4:00 am, and she works with her two daughters. They help her to prepare the dough, and then spend the time it takes for the products to be in the oven. Once she takes the product out of the oven, she places it in a plastic container, and takes it to sell door-to-door to homes and businesses. She thinks that her major advantage is that her products have a special flavor, and, in addition to that, she is a friendly person who gets on well with other people.  This helps her to make sales.

Her dream is to have a place in the town center, even if it is small, so that she no longer has to sell by foot and can have an easier life.  She has diabetes and is still undergoing medical treatment. Every time she returns to her home after finishing her daily work, her health suffers.

The loan that Alejandrina is requesting is needed to buy corn, cheese, sugar, butter and other ingredients to make doughnuts and quesadillas. With the help of this loan, she will be able to generate earnings and cover her medical expenses. She will also help her husband with the financial upkeep of the household.  He works in agriculture and has little income. She also would like to make improvements to her home.

Alejandrina has been receiving the support of loans through FAMA for several years.  She has punctually paid back the loans, and they have helped her to keep her business active and to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, sugar, butter, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 53 años de edad, conviviente y con 2 hijos a cargo. Habita en casa propia en el sector de La Matanza. Tiene buenas referencias laborales y personales.
María se dedica a la venta de harina de jora, así mismo a la crianza y venta de animales menores en su domicilio. 
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 1508 nuevos soles, los cuales se utilizarán para invertirlo en su negocio, específicamente para la compra de maíz duro y arreglo de corral de los animales, para que de esa manera tenga mejores ingresos y en consecuencia una mejor condición de vida en la zona.
La inversión en el negocio la ayudara satisfactoriamente a la cliente , ya que el mercado es potencial para invertir en este tipo de negocio, y los riesgos son menores  para que en corto plazo perciba buenas utilidades.
texts.en:
Maria, 53, lives with her partner and their two children in their house in the La Matanza area.  She is considered a good worker and person.

Maria sells jora flour (corn flour used for making chicha, a typical Peruvian fermented drink) and raises and sells small animals from her house.
She is requesting a loan of 1508 new sols to use for her business, specifically for buying corn kernels and fixing up the pen for her animals.  This way she will have better earnings and thus a better life in the area.
The investment in her business will help her since there is a  market for her type of business and the risks are small.  She will get good money in a short period of time.

loans.use: to buy corn and improve the pen for her livestock

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna, a 38-year-old entrepreneur is married to Lambertus, a 38-year-old man. They are blessed with two children, namely Afila, 5, attending kindergarten and Milani, 2 years old.

Anna is a seamstress and is also running a kiosk business. Anna runs these businesses at her residence. Her husband, Lambertus, is also skilled in sewing clothes and decided to open a sewing business in other place. They are expecting to earn more income from these businesses.  Sometimes Lambertus also helps her to complete stitching orders from customers if she has many orders. 

Since her sewing business is running well, Anna was thinking to improve her kiosk business by completing her inventory with more stock as demanded by customers. She is requesting a loan amounting to 4,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on sugar, eggs, instant foods, coffee, oil, etc.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, eggs, instant foods, coffee, oil, etc.

loans.name: Enos

texts.en: Enos is 28 years old. He sells fruit to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy fruit to sell.

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Zolbaatar

texts.en:
Zolbaatar is a 24-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in Govi-Altai province in Southern Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and takes care of the children. He graduated from the college of Music and Dance. Now he is running a garment retail business. He sells different styles of pants, leggings and trousers with stylish shoes. He has a well positioned shop counter at a big trade center in the town. 

Zolbaatar is a hard-working man who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by buying the supplies in large quantities from the capital city. I will save on transportation expense and spend it on the supplies." The total amount he is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy more pants at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To buy more pants at wholesale prices

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 60 years old and widowed with five children. Cristita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Cristita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soft drinks, other beverages and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Cristita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Dolorosa

texts.en:
Dolorosa works hard to support her family. Dolorosa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, sugar and other miscellaneous items. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Dolorosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, sugar and other miscellaneous items

loans.name: Josema

texts.en:
Josema is 47 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like rice, shampoo, and other goods to sell in her store.

Josema has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Josema aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, shampoo, and other goods

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 61 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase merchandise to supply her general store.

Lucy has been in this business for 40 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to supply her general store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like pants, blouses and other clothing to sell. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, blouses and other clothing.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Purevsuren is a 59-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in Govi-Altai province in Southern Mongolia. Her husband is specialist of NSO, and her daughters study at a college. Her youngest, a son, studies at the local secondary school. She has been running a garment retail business since 2005. The business has been successful and profitable. She has many regular customers in the town who are happy to purchase their clothes from her. 

Purevsuren is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by buying supplies wholesale to increase the range of goods I offer." The total amount she is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to buy more garments.

loans.use: To buy more garments

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Debbie works hard to support her family.

She has a wholesaling and retailing salt business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store. Debbie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her salt making business.

Debbie has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her salt making.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pottery making business in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her pottery.

Susan has been in this business for fifteen years now, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 37 years old, married with 3 children. She sells used clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years and describes her business environment as busy because many people do business in that area. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy used clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy used clothes for sale

loans.name: Maria Albertina

texts.es:
Doña María, es casada, tiene 59 años de edad, tiene 1 hija  y vive junto a ellas en su propia casa de habitación  en el departamento de Valle en el sur de Honduras.
El negocio de Doña María es la venta de golosinas en su casa de habitación en el barrio donde vive que esta cerca de la plaza central de su pueblo, en la zona sur de Honduras.
Doña María esta solicitando la cantidad de 5,000.00 lempiras para la compra de harina, verduras, aceite, condimentos y otros productos para la elaboración de golosinas para dar más satisfacción a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ventas.
Doña María entre sus sueños el principal es construir un mejor local para su negocio con esto agrandar su clientela para tener mas ingresos que puedan ayudar a sacar a su familia adelante.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Doña Maria is married. She is 59 years old and has one daughter who lives with them in their own house in the department of Valle in the south of Honduras.

Doña Maria's business is selling snacks from her home in the neighborhood where she lives, which is close to the central plaza of her town, in the southern zone of Honduras.

Donã Maria is applying for a loan of 5,000 lempiras to purchase flour, vegetables, oil, condiments, and other products for the preparation of snacks to give greater satisfaction to her customers and in this way generate more sales.

Among Doña Maria's dreams, the principal one is to construct a better location for her business so that she can increase her clientele in order to have more income, which can help her family to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy flour, vegetables, oil, condiments, and other products for her business

loans.name: Ajok

texts.en:
Ajok lives in Bor. She is 38 years old, married and has five children, three of whom are still in school. 

Ajok sells items at a food stall and has been in business for five years. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer; this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for a food stall.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a single lady with one child aged three years.  She owns a retail shop in Kapsabet and has been in operation for a period of three years, earning a monthly income of KES. 3,500. 

She is taking out her first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use the amount to purchase sugar, cooking fat, washing bar soaps, bread, wheat flour, and maize flour. 

The profits will be used to repay the loan and, she hopes, to improve her business and her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking fat, washing bar soaps, bread, wheat flour, and maize flour.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is 25 years old, married with 2 children. She sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living. She has been in the business for 8 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business and hopes to expand it in the future. She has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Afiavi Christine's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux personnes. La représentante du nom d'Afiavi Christine est âgée de 30ans. Afiavi christine est célibataire sans enfant. Elle est a un niveau d'instruction primaire. Pour supporter les charges quotidiennes, elle mène comme activité la vente des sous-vêtements, parfums, couches, et produits cosmétiques à la boutique depuis près de cinq ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Afiavi Christine sollicite, ensemble avec sa coéquipière, un micro-crédit auprès de Finadev. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à droite de la photo.
texts.en: his group is composed of two persons. The group’s representative, Afiavi Christine, is 30 years old. She is single without children. She has received primary education. In order to support herself, for the last five years she has been selling underwear, perfumes, diapers and cosmetic products. She stocks up at a market in Benin. With the goal of better meeting customer demand, Afiavi Christine, together with her other team member, is seeking a microloan from Finadev. Afiavi Christine is the one on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy  30 set of underwear, 20 perfumes, 15 produits cosmetic products and 10 diapers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, ovens, cake plates, and mirrors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, noodles, and canned goods, among other items) for her store

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man, aged 33 years, and a father of four children aged eight, six, four and one year.  He buys and sells milk and has been in operation for a period of four years earning a monthly income of KES. 6,000.

He is requesting a loan of KES. 20,000 as his first term loan from KADET LTD and wishes to use the loan to pay his milk suppliers.  The profits will be used to plough back into the business and repay the loan. He wishes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To pay his milk suppliers

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 34 years old, married to Gladys, and blessed with three children. He sells potatoes, a business he started a year ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more Irish potatoes for sale. The profit he makes will be ploughed back into his business. His dream is to expand his business and improve his living standard. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Rafiatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux personnes. La représentante du nom de Rafiatou est âgée de 24ans. Rafiatou est fiancée sans enfant. Elle est a un niveau d'instruction secondaire. Pour supporter les charges quotidiennes, Rafiatou mène comme activité la vente des vêtements prêt-à-porter dans une boutique depuis quatre ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans l'optique de répondre aux exigences de la clientèle et de faire plus de profit, elle sollicite, ensemble avec sa coéquipière, un premier crédit auprès de Finadev. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en: This group is composed of two persons. The group’s representative, Rafiatou, is 24 years old. She is  engaged to be married and has no children. She has received  secondary education. In order to support herself, for the last four years she has been selling ready-to-wear clothing in a store She stocks up at a market in Benin. With the goal of better meeting customer demand and increasing her revenues, Rafiatou, together with her other team member, is seeking her first loan from Finadev. Rafiatou is the one on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 10 dresses, 10  blouses and 10 shirts.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 38 years old and married with 2 children. He sells clothes and bags to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Benson has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy clothes and bags to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes and bags to sell.

loans.name: Nyiel

texts.en:
Nyiel lives in Bor. She is 32 years old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Nyiel sells food at a food stall. She's been in this business for 5 years.

This is Nyiel's third loan from BRAC. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. She has requested a loan of 1200 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her childrens' school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen lives in Bor. She is 38 years old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. She sells fish and has been in this business for 5 years. 

Ayen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her childrens' school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Segundo Bolivar

texts.es:
Segundo Bolívar tiene 37 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en  Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, los socios se dedican la mayor parte de su tiempo en la agricultura, siembra de maíz y crianza de animales.
Segundo Bolívar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de tomate, mora, maíz, fréjol. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, líquidos para la maleza, abonos químicos, insecticidas. Las compras y las ventas lo hará en San Pablo de Atenas.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insecticidas que tanto le hacen falta para mejorar la producción El sueño es poder tener una buena casa.  Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es pagar  el crédito antes del tiempo acordado.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota y disfrutar de las fiestas de la Virgen del Guayco.
texts.en: Segundo Bolívaris is 37 years old, single and has no children. He lives with his parents in Chillanes, province of Bolívar. He's part of the Virgen De Baños community bank in Mama Sara De Cerritos, where the majority of the members make a living in agriculture, planting corn and raising livestock. Segundo makes a living planting tomatoes, blackberries, corn and beans. He is requesting the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, chemical compounds and insecticides. He makes his transactions in San Pablo de Atenas. With the help of the loan he will be able to purchase insecticides that he needs to increase his production. His dream is to be able to have a good home. The challenge he faces is paying the loan in the allotted time. In his free time he likes to play sports and attend the Virgen del Guayco festival.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, chemical compounds and insecticides.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto Gabriel

texts.es:
Cesar es un joven de 25 años que ha luchado mucho y ha sabido salir adelante junto a su madre, a la cual ama mucho y esta gustoso de poder cuidar de ella. El tuvo que mudarse vivienda, debido a que quedo muy deteriorada debido al intenso terremoto del año 2007.

Cuando él se mudo, se dio cuenta que esa zona no había ninguna bodega, es por eso que junto a su madre decidieron abrir esta pequeña tienda, a la cual se dedica aproximadamente 5 años, en todo este tiempo ha aprendido a realizar las compras necesarias de los productos que sus clientes más necesitan, ya que esto le permite tener un ingreso para poder pagar las necesidades básicas de su hogar.

Con un poco de apoyo, Cesar podrá realizar la compra de algunos productos que están por acabársele, tales como arroz, azúcar, atún, leche, entre otros. El piensa realizar una gran compra disminuyendo sus gastos, es así como desea poner mucho más de su esfuerzo y dedicación para incrementar sus ingresos y pagar sus estudios de Mantenimiento en Procesos Industriales.
texts.en: Cesar is a young man of 25 who has fought hard to make headway along with his mother, whom he loves very much and is happy to take care of. He had to move because of the damaged caused by an intense earthquake in 2007. When he moved, he realized he was in an area that didn't have any convenience stores, which is why he and his mother decided to open the small store he has dedicated himself to for the past five years. Over that time he has learned how to make the necessary purchases to bring in the products his customers most need, and it allows him to earn an income to pay for basic necessities at home. With a little support, Cesar will be able to purchase some products that he is about to run out of, such as rice, sugar, tuna, milk, and other items. He plans to buy in bulk to lower his margins, and in this way he will put even more effort and dedication to grow his sales and pay for his education in industrial management.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, tuna, milk, etc.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a young client, age 27 years old, is married and has one child.

Ahmad has been an owner of a food market since 2010 selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to make sliding door and ceiling for his market and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to make sliding door and ceiling for his market and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Atong

texts.en:
Atong lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 36 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are still in school. 

Atong heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 South Sudanese pounds (SDG) in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 55 years old and married with three children. He sells cows and goats to earn a living. He has been in this business for three years and has employed one person. To earn extra income he does farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan for 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy goats and cows for sale.

loans.use: to buy goats and cows for sale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 20 years old, married to Linah, and blessed with four children. He sells pyrethrum, a business he started a year ago, and earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He has requested for a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase more pyrethrum for sale. 

The profit he makes will be ploughed back into his business. His dream is to educate his children. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of pyrethrum for sale.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1970 à San, Moussa vit avec ses 9 enfants et sa femme dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie dans la commune rurale de Fakola. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, Monsieur Moussa s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des animaux (bœufs, chèvres, moutons etc.)  Il est très apprécié et sollicité à Fakola et environs.  
Moussa est à son premier prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 10 bœufs dans les villages environnants. Il effectue ses ventes, au comptant et en détail, en république de Côte d’Ivoire et dans les foires voisines à une clientèle composée essentiellement de bouchers et d’éleveurs. 
Moussa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 125.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les affaires.
texts.en:
Born around 1970 in San, Moussa lives with his 9 children and his wife in a large, traditional family setting in the rural community of Fakola. Not having had the opportunity to go to school, Moussa quickly became engaged in revenue-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of animals (oxen, goats, sheep, etc.). He is highly regarded and sought-out in Fakola and the surrounding area.

Moussa is on his 1st loan, which will be used to buy 10 oxen in the surrounding villages. He sells his animals for cash, in the Republic of Ivory Coast as well as in neighbouring markets, to a retail clientele mainly composed of butchers and breeders. Moussa hopes to make a monthly profit of 125 000 francs, which he will use to provide for his family's needs, repay the loan and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy oxen.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for the labor.

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Akoko est une femme âgée de 26ans. Elle est mariée à un employé dans une société et a 02 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 07ans et le dernier 04ans. Elle est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale(riz, huile végétale, sucre et autres) depuis 2009 à la maison. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et sa difficulté principale est la mévente. Elle est à son premier crédit à WAGES et sollicite ce montant pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle. Elle renforcer son activité, agrandir pour en faire une boutique et subvenir aux besoins de la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akoko is a 26 years old woman. She's married to a company employee and has two school-attending children, age 7 and 4.

Since 2009, she's been reselling food staples (rice, vegetable oil, sugar, and others) at her home. She gets her supplies in Lomé, and her main difficulty is her low sales volume.

She's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy more products and better meet customer demand.

She wants to bolster her business, expand it and turn it into a shop, and provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy food staples

loans.name: Aguissi

texts.fr:
Aguissi est une femme âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un officier de police. Elle a 2 enfants. 
Aguissi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle vend du charbon de bois et du maïs pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Sotouboua, Sokodé et Kara. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Aguissi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbon de bois et du maïs. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Aguissi voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aguissi is a 42-year-old woman, married to a police officer. She has two children.

Since 2009, she's been a reseller. She sells charcoal and corn at her home to all kinds of customers.

She gets her products in Sotouboua, Sokodé and Kara. She works alone. At this time, her main difficulty is being unable to meet all customers' demands.

Aguissi is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy sacks of charcoal and corn. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to expand her business. She says that she intends to use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and corn

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr:
Améyo est une femme âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée å un professeur. Elle a 4 enfants qui ne fréquentent pas.
Améyo travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle vend du charbon de bois pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Améyo a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Améyo voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Améyo is 54 years old and married to a teacher. She has four children who do not go to school.

Since 2000, she's been working as a reseller. She sells charcoal at her home to all kinds of customers.

She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone. At this time, her main difficulty is being out of stock.

Améyo is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy charcoal. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to expand her business. She says that she intends to use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Adjowavi

texts.fr:
Adjowavi est une femme âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un conducteur. Elle a 2 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier a 10 ans.
Adjowavi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1994. Elle est revendeuse de céréales pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir pas satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Adjowavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjowavi voudrait augmenter son stock de marchandise. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adjowavi is 39 years old and married to a driver. She has two children who both attend school. The oldest is 15, the youngest is 10 years old. 

Since 1994, she's been working as a reseller. She resells cereals to all kinds of customers at the market. She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone.

At this time, her main difficulty is being unable to meet customer demand.

Adjowavi is seeking her first  loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy cereals. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to bolster her stock of products. She says that she intends to use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en:
Rezo is 55 years old. He lives in a small village in Khoni District, West Georgia. Rezo lives with his family: his 36-year-old daughter, son-in-law and two grandchildren (16 and 12 years old).  The children go to school. 

The family has a pig. They sell on average 9 piglets per year. Also, Rezo and his son-in-law work as workers in the village. They perform various work when they get orders. Although all family members work hard, they still live in poverty. Their total average monthly income is 330 Laris. 

Rezo requested credit to start-up a dairy farm. His loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative from Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program envisages provisioning business start-ups and re-startups with credit with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Rezo will purchase a milk cow. He will place it in the old cattle-shed located in his yard. He will start the production of cheese and sell it on local open market. The income for the family will increase by 150 – 200 Laris, which will mean 45 – 60% increase. The living conditions for the family will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: buy a milk cow

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is fifty-two years old. He lives in a small village of Kakheti Region, East Georgia with his wife, Nargiz. Levan works in a local dairy products processing factory as a shift supervisor. His monthly salary is 400 Laris and it is the only income of the family during the month. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Levan requested credit to start-up a pig farm. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing businesses with start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions. This is important for the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Levan will start up a pig farm. He will purchase five pigs and feed for them. After five or six months Levan will have piglets for sale. He will sell piglets in the village, as well as on the local open market. The family will sell on average 45 piglets per year. The income of the family will increase by 300 – 400 Laris per month, which will mean 75 – 100% increase. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve and in the future they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, for further expansion of the family farm.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to start up a pig-farm.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is 45 years old. She lives in Samtredia District with her family: husband – Zviad, 19-year-old daughter, 18-year-old son, and mother-in-law. Khatuna’s son goes to school and her daughter plans to enter high school next year. Khatuna works as a saleslady in a village store. She spends the whole day in the store and her monthly salary equals to 200 Laris.  Zviad takes care of a milk cow owned by the family. The dairy products are mainly consumed by the family and the surplus is sold in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris, including the pension of Khatuna’s mother-in-law. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistent poor category. 

Khatuna requested credit to start-up a trade business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative from Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisioning business start-ups and re-startups with credit on soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Khatuna will purchase a mini-bus to trade greengrocery products. Zviad will lead the business. He will purchase various greengrocery products from local farmers at wholesale prices and sell them in nearby towns with a price mark-up. The new business initiative will increase the monthly income for the family by 300 Laris, which will mean a 75% increase. The living conditions for the family will improve and in the future they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: purchase mini-bus to trade fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Valodia

texts.en:
Valodia, 51 years old, lives in a village in Telavi District, East Georgia with his wife, Marine, and his retired father. The family owns a vineyard from which Valodia produces wine to sell in the village. Total average family monthly income is 200 Laris. According to Credo estimations, they belong to the subsistence-poor category.

Valodia has requested a loan to begin a new agricultural business, the raising of calves. He will purchase 10 – 11 calves to raise in an old cattle-shed located in his yard. After six months he will sell the grown calves for a profit. Valodia hopes that with a second future loan he will be able to purchase more calves to raise. The family's income will significantly increase, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions. Also, in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

Valodia's loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and follow-up loans to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Farkiniso

texts.ru: Фаркинисо умная,трудолюбивая,ответственная женщина в возрасти 48 лет.она замужем и на воспитании имеет четверых детей.Более 6 лет она  занимается купле-продажей малого рогатого скота. В месяц 2-3 раза ездит с мужем на рынок и покупает скот. Откармливает в течении  одного месяца и снова продает на скотном рынке.В бизнесе ей помогают её дети и муж. А её муж частный таксист и он очень уважает свою жену и детей.Они все вмести дружно работают.От данного бизнеса она получает хороший доход и постоянно улучшает свое благосостояние семьи.Фаркинисо запрашивает займ для покупки малого рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса.Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Farkiniso is a smart, hard-working, responsible woman at the age of 48. She is married and is raising four children. She has been engaged in buying and selling small livestock for more than six years. She goes to the market 2-3 times per month together with her husband to buy livestock. Then she fattens them for about one month and again sells the livestock at the market. 

Her husband and children helps her in her business. Her husband is a private taxi driver and he respects his wife and children very much. They all work together. From this business she receives a good income and constantly improves the family's well-being. 

Farkiniso asks for a loan for the purchase of small livestock with an aim to expand her business. She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock

loans.name: Taguhi

texts.en:
Taguhi lives in Vanadzor and she has a daughter who is a second year student of Vanadzor State teachers' training institute. Taguhi’s daughter is a student of the history faculty and she hopes to find a job in a school after graduation. 

Taguhi is 41 years old and she lives in Vanadzor with her only daughter since Taguhi’s husband lives in Russia. 

Taguhi works at a gas service office as an inspector and thus she provides herself and her daughter. She is a 4th cycle client of Nor Horizon and she needs a 90,000 AMD loan to pay her daughter’s tuition fees for the second semester.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Jhonny Humberto

texts.es: Jhonny de 26 años vive ( Quevedo ecuador ). El empezó esta negocio hace  12 años . por motivo de que necesitaba ingreso para el . el negocio lo vende en el mercado calderón le va muy bien . trabaja todos los días solo con mucho esfuerzo y ganas . tiene una unión libre tiene 2 hijos .la dificultad que tiene es el invierno . a futuro el anhela tener un negocio mas grande . con el préstamo comprara (cebollas tomates etc ).
texts.en: Jhonny, 26, lives in Quevedo, Ecuador.  He started his business 12 years ago because he needed the income.  He sells vegetables in the Calderón Market and business is doing very well, thanks to the hard work and determination he puts into it every day.  He lives with his common-law wife and two children.  In the winter he experiences some difficulties.  He wants to expand his business in the future.  The loan will be used to buy onions, tomatoes, etc.

loans.use: To buy onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Tartha

texts.en:
Tartha lives in Bor. She sells food from a stall and has been in business for five years. She is 34 years old and married with five children, three of whom are still in school. 

Tartha heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 54, is married with six children and sells firewood to earn a living. She has been in this business for nine years and has employed one person. To earn extra income, she farms.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Elizabeth has been able to educate her children and she hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy firewood for resale.

loans.use: to buy firewood for resale.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 53 years old and lives in Yerevan. Armen works at an auto assembly organization as a metalworker and his wife works at confectionery as a candy maker.
  
He has two children who are both students. Armen’s daughter is a fourth year student at the Armenian “Haybusak” University and she studies at the design and clothes modeling department. Armen’s son is a third year student at the State Engineering University of Armenia and he studies at the cybernetics department.
 
Armen is asking for a 250,000 AMD loan to pay for his children’s tuition fees for second semester.

loans.use: to pay for his children’s tuition fees for second semester.

loans.name: Etefania Monserrate

texts.es: Estefania de 21 años vive ( duran Ecuador ) ella empezó hace 4 años a dar clases de ingles porque esa es su vocación  , aparte enseña mas materias pero su profesión es el ingles .es casada no tiene hijos  su esposo es maquinista . trabaja todos los días sola con mucho amor y ganas . a futuro anhela dar clase a niños jóvenes y adultos y tener hijos y darle una buena vida . con el presatmo comprara ( utiles libros ect ).
texts.en: Estefania, 21, lives in Duran, Ecuador.  She began teaching English lessons four years ago, because it was her vocation.  She also teaches other subjects but her profession is teaching English.  She is married and has no children.  Her husband is an engineer.  She works alone every day, with a lot of love and enthusiasm.  In the future she wants to teach children, adolescents and adults, and also have her own children and give them a good life.  She will use the loan to buy books, etc.

loans.use: To buy books.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer lives in Bor. She sells food from a stall and has been in business for five years. She is 38 years old and married with five children, three of whom are still in school.

Amer heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Awel

texts.en:
Awel lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 38 years old and married with five children, three of whom are still in school.

Awel heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her second loan. She has requested 800 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert,30, sells bags and shoes to earn a living. He has been in this business for four years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people run the same business.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Albert has been able to grow his business and he hopes to own a boutique in the future. He has applied for a loan of 25,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy bags and shoes for resale.

loans.use: to buy bags and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Lachica's Group

texts.en:
Lachica, 56, is married with two children and lives in Tuburan District, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur.

She has a shop that sells different kinds of clothes, a business she has had for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her clothing business.

Lachica has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to open another shop for expansion.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her clothing business.

location.town: Pagadian-Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca, 31, is married with three children. She sells carpets, mats and fabric to earn a living. She has been in this business for four years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition.

Since joining Faulu Kenya, Prisca has been able to improve her business and she hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy carpets, mats and fabric for resale.

loans.use: to buy carpets, mats and fabric for resale.

loans.name: Delfa Mercedes

texts.es:
Delfa Mercedes tiene 39 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los familiares en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, los socios se dedican la mayor parte de su tiempo en la agricultura, siembra de maíz y crianza de animales.

Delfa Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, tomate , fréjol, maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar líquidos para la maleza, insumos, abonos, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas. Las compras y las ventas lo hará en San Pablo de Atenas cada semana.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar los cultivos.  Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es mejorar la situación económica de la familia.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y leer la Biblia.
texts.en:
Delfa Mercedes, 39, is single and has no children.  She lives with relatives in Chillanes, in Bolívar Province.  

The communal bank VIRGEN DE BAÑOS is located in the "Mama Sara de Cerritos" community.  Most of its members are involved in agriculture, growing corn or raising livestock.  

Delfa Mercedes is a farmer who grows blackberries, tomatoes, beans and corn.  She is requesting a loan to buy weed killers, compost, fertilizer, urea, insecticides and supplies.  Every week she goes to San Pablo de Atenas to buy and sell.

With the help of the loan she will be able to improve her crops.  The main challenge she is up against is improving the economic situation of her family.

In her free time she enjoys relaxing and reading the Bible.

loans.use: To buy weed killers, compost, fertilizers, urea, insecticides and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy earrings, sheets and perfumes.

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene, 19, is single and lives in Lapidian, Pagadian City. He is a farmer and sells vegetables and rice grains for a living. He has been doing this for three years. 

Eugene has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase more stock for his farm supplies business. He has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, he hopes to expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his farm supplies business.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, 29, is single and supports three members of his family. He sells livestock, a business he started four years ago, and he earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

Wilson has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase more cows for resale. The profit he makes will be invested back into his business. His dream is to expand his business. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for resale.

loans.name: Jhohana Gladys

texts.es: Jhohana de 31 años vive (duran Ecuador ) ella escogió este negocio por que su esposo la abandono con sus hijos . ella necesitaba dinero para alimentar a sus hijos y darle para sus estudios . trabaja todos los días sola con mucho esfuerzo y ganas para salir adelante . a futuro ella anhela tener su casa propia . con el préstamo comprara ( cosméticos ).
texts.en: Jhohana, 31, lives in Duran, Ecuador.  She chose this business to go into after her husband left her and the children, and she needed an income to feed them and give them an education.  She works alone every day with much effort and determination to get ahead.  In the future she wants to have her own house.  She plans to use to the loan to buy cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is a married man aged 28 years and is blessed with two children aged four and two years old.  He operates a retail shop in Kapsabet, which has been in operation for a period of six years earning a monthly income of KES 6,000.

He has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 as his first loan from KADET LTD., and intends to use this amount to purchase rice, bread, sugar, tea leaves, wheat flour, and maize flour. 

The profits will be used to reinvest into the business. He wishes to expand his business and be self-sustainable.

loans.use: To purchase stock for his business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Twenty-seven year-old Gladys is married to Philemon and blessed with two children. She owns a retail shop, a business she started one year ago; she earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested a loan worth KES 10, 000 to purchase packs of sugar, salt, boxes of bar soaps, and detergents for sale. 

The profit earned from the business will help her repay her loan and expand her business. Her dream is to see her business expand, and to educate her children. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase packs of sugar, salt, boxes of bar soaps, and detergents.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is 30 years-old and married to Monica; they are blessed with three children aged four, three, and one years old. He owns a retail shop, a business he ventured in one year ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase a bale of baking flour, detergents, and boxes of bar soaps. The anticipated profit would be reinvested in his business. 

His dream is to educate his children as well as expand his business. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of baking flour, detergents, and boxes of bar soaps.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 37 years-old and married to Elias; they are blessed with one child. She runs a tailoring shop, a business she started 10 years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

Veronica has applied for a loan of KES 20,000, which she will use to purchase cloth materials for sale. Her profit will contribute towards her buying a plot. She hopes to improve her family’s living standard. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 31 years-old, and is not yet married. He has owned his fruit and vegetable business for five years. He plans to use his loan to buy more fresh fruits and vegetables for sale. 

With the anticipated profits he intends to buy a motorbike that will enable him to transport produce faster. He dreams of expanding his business so that it becomes large enough to be able to support a family and employ others.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is twenty-six years old, married, with one child. She runs a cafeteria to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years and describes her business environment as good because she has many regular customers. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy furniture for her cafeteria and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her cafeteria and cooking oil.

loans.name: Abul

texts.en:
Abul lives in Bor. She sells food from a food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is thirty-eight years old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Abul heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Vakhid

texts.en:
Vakhid is fifty years old. He lives in Gardabani District with his big family: his wife – Sigjun, a twenty-six-year-old son, his daughter-in-law, parents-in-law and brother-in-law. Vakhid works as a taxi dirver in the district. Along with his main job, Vakhid is actively involved in the family's agricultural business. They have two milk cows and sell milk in the village. Along with the above-mentioned the family has rented land, where broom is grown. Sigjun makes brooms and sells them on the local market.  The total average monthly income of the family is 1,100 Laris, including the pensions of Vakhid’s parents-in-law. 

Vakhid requested credit to purchase three milk cows. The family will be able to sell more milk. This will increase the monthly income of the family on average by 450 Laris. They will be able to increase spending on their own needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows.

loans.name: Maria Jhaneth

texts.es: Maria de 49 años vive ( playas villamil ) ella empezó con muchas actividades por el motivo de que enviudo .decidio hace 6 años vender cosmeticos . es soltera no tiene  hijos asi que su trabajo lo hace sola todos los días .  a fururo ella anhela tener un negocio grande . la dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia . con el presatmo comprara ( cosméticos ).
texts.en: Maria is 49 years old. She lives in Playas Villamil. She started doing a lot of activities because she was widowed. Six years ago, she decided to sell cosmetics. She is single and has no children, so she does her job alone every day. In the future, she hopes to have a large business. Crime is a problem for her. She will buy cosmetics with the loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is thirty-one years old and the mother of one child. She sells used shoes to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and employs one person. To earn extra income she does vegetable farming. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy used shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Kubai

texts.en:
Kubai is a married man. He has two children aged two and six. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as sugar, salt, blueband (margarine), stationery etc. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a conducive environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of goods sold. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more home products such as sugar, salt etc. His business goal is to run another retail store within five years.

loans.use: to buy more home products to sell.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a fifty-two year old married man. He has four children whose ages range from twenty-five to thirty-four. He describes himself as faithful and honest. He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as sugar, salt, blueband (margarine), stationery etc. He has been involved in this business for six years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a conducive environment. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficcient funds for expanding the business. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more home products such as sugar, salt etc. His business goal is to run a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more home products to sell.

loans.name: Athau

texts.en:
Athau lives in Bor. She sells food on a food stall, and has been in business for two years. She is thirty-four years old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Athau heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Fe Y Alegria Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento FE Y ALEGRIA  esta compuesta por ocho integrantes todas mujeres que se dedican a distintas actividades,  la presidenta del banco es La Sra. Kelly  tiene 24 años, no esta casada pero convive con su pareja tiene 2 hijos de las edades de 3 y 8 años que son dependientes, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida en su puesto de venta  que es en su mismo domicilio y ella vive en la localidad de Pedro Lorenzo,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Kelly utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas como arroz y fideo, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital de trabajo, la Sra. Kelly  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son dar una atención de calidad y la competencia, y  utilizara los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, su  sueño para su negocio es contar con mas clientela y así de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: The FE Y ALEGRIA venture bank is made up of eight members. All of them are women who work at different activities. The president of the bank is Kelly. She is 24 years old and isn't married but lives with her partner. They have two dependent children, aged 3 and 8. She makes and sells food from her home. She lives in the town of Pedro Lorenzo. This loan is her first with the institution. Kelly will use this loan to buy ingredients for her food, such as rice and pasta. The reason she is asking for this loan is to increase her working capital. Kelly faces challenges in her business such as providing quality service and the competition. She will use the profits to improve her quality of life. Her dream for her business is to have more customers and thus increase her financial income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, pasta and sugar.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a fifty-seven-year-old married man. He has five children whose ages range from twenty-six to thirty-four. He describes himself as honest and ambitious. He operates a motor vehicle and provides transportation services to customers. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good market area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as the high price of oil. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for the motor vehicle. Within five years, Stanley's dream and business goal is to own at least five more vehicles.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more home products to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, thirty-nine years old, is married with three school-aged children. Marilyn has been engaged in a hog-raising business for two years. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy a sack of feed and a piglet for her business. 

Marilyn is a very responsible parent, she makes sure that she gives her family all that they need. She hopes that someday her business will expand to give her family a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sack of feed and a piglet for her business.

loans.name: Rasto

texts.en:
Rasto is twenty-nine years old and is married with a four-year-old daughter. For the last two years he has been running a bicycle transportation business where he transports people and goods around Nakuru town.

With this loan he plans to buy a new bicycles for his business and hopes to eventually to buy a motorbike to offer his customers efficient services.

loans.use: to buy more bicycles for his transportation business.

loans.name: Nyalawa

texts.en:
Nyalawa lives in Bor. She sells food from a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is thirty years old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Nyalawa heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,200 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Ninfa Cruz

texts.es: Ninfa de 54 años vive ( isla - Guayaquil ). Ella decidió ponerse un comedor ´porque su especialidad es la cocina . trabaja todos los días sola a veces la ayuda su hija desde la 7:00 a 2:00 pm. Le va bien porque desde que empezó su casa era de caña ahora es de madera y a futuro anhela que sea de cemento. Con el préstamo comprara ( cemento, arena, bloques, pinturas para construir mejor su casa y asi mejorar su negocio).
texts.en: Ninfa is 54 years old and lives on an island in Guayaquil. She decided to build a dining room because her specialty is cooking. She works alone every day from 7:00 to 2:00pm, and sometimes has the help of her daughter. Things are going well for her because when she began, her house was made of cane and now it's made of wood. In the future she longs for it to be made of cement. With the loan she will buy cement, sand, blocks, and paintings to better build her home and thus improve her business.

loans.use: cement, sand, blocks, and paintings.

loans.name: Angelita Reina

texts.es: Angelitta de 43 años vive ( fortin Guayaquil ). Ella comenzó vendiendo un terreno en el campo. Luego de que su esposo la abandono ella decidió establecer un bazar - tienda para poder sustentar a su familia . tiene dos hijos y es separada. Trabaja todos los días con mucho esfuerzo y ganas . la dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. A futuro ella anhela que sus hijos terminen sus estudios universitarios y mejorar su cas. Con el presta  comprara ( ropa, enlatados, bebidas, utiles).
texts.en: Angelitta is 43 years old and lives in Fortin in Guayaquil. She began by selling a plot of land in the countryside. After her husband left her, she decided to start a stationary shop and store in order to be able to support her family. She has two children and is separated. She works very hard every day putting in much effort. The problem she has is crime. In the future she longs for her children to finish college and improve their lives. She will buy clothes, canned goods, drinks, and supplies with the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes, canned goods, drinks, and supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Marlene

texts.es: Rosa de 51 años vive ( playas villamil ). ella empezo este negocio hace 7 años vendiendo salchichas y fritada le va muy bien en su negocio . aparte se dedica a vender cosmeticos y a la crianza de pollos . es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que lo hace sola desde las 4:00 am a 23:00 la dificultad que tiene es la enfermedad de ella es soltera . a futuro anhela tener su casa . con el prestamo comprara ( viveres ).
texts.en: Rosa is 51 years old and lives in Playas (Villamil). She began her business 7 years ago selling sausage and fried food. Things are going well for her with her business. Aside from this she makes a living selling cosmetics and raising chicken. She's a hardworking woman as she does this by herself from 4:00am until 11:00pm. The difficulty that she has is her sickness. She is single and in the future she longs to have a home. With the loan she will buy supplies.

loans.use: to buy blouses.

loans.name: La Paz 32 Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario LA PAZ 32 esta compuesta por tres integrantes todas mujeres que se dedican a la venta de ropa, la coordinadora del grupo es la Sra. Pastora  tiene 61 años y es viuda sus hijos ya independientes, la Sra. pastora se dedica a la venta de ropa interior en su puesto de venta que s e encuentra en uno de los mercados mas concurridos  de la ciudad de Cochabamba que se encuentran, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Pastora utilizara  este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería ropa interior por mayor para su negocio. La razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Pastora  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la  competencia y utilizara los beneficios para incrementar sus ventas e ingresos, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: The solidarity group La Paz 32 consists of three members, all women, who sell clothes. The group coordinator, Pastora, is 61 years old, a widow, and her children live on their own. Pastora sells underwear at her stall, located in one of the busiest markets of the city of Cochabamba. This loan is her second one with the field partner, and she will use it to buy underwear wholesale for her business. The reason behind the loan is to augment her working capital. Pastora's challenge concerning her business is the existence of competitors. She will use the profits to increase her sales and income. She is thankful for the opportunity this loan represents.

loans.use: to buy underwear wholesale.

loans.name: Grace Monilola's Group

texts.fr: Agée de 44 ans, Grace Monilola est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle vit chez son mari ou elle mène ses activités. Elle a sollicité un concours auprès de Finadev pour renforcer ses activités afin d'agrandir son fonds de commerce et surtout supporter la charge scolaire de ses enfants. Elle est en caution avec Anna Mahuton qui commercialise aussi des divers. Grace Monilola et à droite de la photo.
texts.en:
Grace Monilola, aged 44, is a married mother of four children. She lives with her husband, she runs her businesses. She has requested funding from Finadev for bolstering her business in order to expand her working capital and especially to cover her children's schooling costs. 

She takes this loan along with Anna Mahuton, who also markets a variety of goods. Grace Monilola is at the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a box of skin lotion, a box of spaghetti, 10 lengths of fabric, and 20 liters of oil

loans.name: Sembrando Esperanza Group

texts.es: Ynes de 38 años es separada con 02 hijos dependientes, la cual han sido su motivo para seguir adelante. Hace 20 años que se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas, su madre fue quien la motivo a emprender su propio negocio, ya que también se dedicaba a dicha actividad. Ynes se siente feliz pues a pesar de la gran responsabilidad que tuvo al educar sola a sus hijos a logrado cumplir una de sus metas el de construir su vivienda. Instalar una bodega en su domicilio es su siguiente meta. Con el  crédito que solicito va invertir en su negocio comprando frutas como tunas, paltas y chirimoyas y así tener que ofrecer  a sus clientes. Ynes es socia de la Alcancía Comunal “Sembrando Esperanza” la cual está conformado por 09 personas dedicadas a distintas actividades comerciales. Ellos agradecen la ayuda brindada y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien con el Programa- Prosperidad.
texts.en: Ynes, aged 38, is separated and has 2 children in her care, which are her reason for moving ahead in life. For the last 20 years, she has bought and sold fruit; her mother was the one who motivated her into setting up her own business, since she also dealt in the same trade. Ynes is happy because, in spite of the great responsibility of raising two children on her own, she managed to accomplish one of her goals: that of building her own house. Her next objective is to install a small grocery store in her house. With the loan she asks for, she will invest in her business by buying produce such as prickly pears, avocadoes and custard apples so as to have something to offer her customers. Ynes is a member of the communal bank "Sembrando Esperanza" ("Sowing Hope"), comprised of 9 members involved in various commercial activities. They all offer their thanks for the help and support and promise to continue working well with the field partner.

loans.use: to buy prickly pears, avocadoes and custard apples.

loans.name: Rosa Mariana

texts.es: Rosa de 48 años vive (orquídeas Guayaquil ). Ella antes trabajaba en una peluquería pero decidió que era mejor tener su propio negocio y que las ganancias solo eran para ella . por ese motivo puso su peluquería y aparte  vende cosméticos. hasta ahora le va bien y se alegra de haber tomado esa decisión. a futuro anhela tener su negocio mas grande y tener personal profesional. Con el prestamo comprara ( cosmeticos, tijeras, plancha para cabello, tintes).
texts.en: Rosa, who is 48 years old, lives in the community of Las Orquideas, in the city of Guayaquil. She used to work at a hairdresser's but decided it was better to set up her own business, prefering profits to a salary. This is why she started her own salon and sells cosmetics on the side. In the future, she hopes to make her business grow and hire employees. With this loan, she will buy cosmetics, scissors, a hair iron and dyes.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, scissors, a hair iron and dyes.

loans.name: Misheck

texts.en:
Misheck is a married man. He has one son who is 5 years old. He describes himself as an assertive man. He operates a grocery store where he sells vegetables and fruits such as mangoes, kale, onions, tomatoes, cabbages, etc. He has been involved in this business for six years. 

Misheck's business is located within a busy, viable market and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as the poor road network in his area of operation, leading to low purchasing power from customers. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more vegeables and fruits for selling. His business goal is to venture into a wholesale shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 54 years old and married to Sophia. They are blessed with seven children. He is a farmer, a practice he ventured into 12 years ago. He earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

Jackson has requested a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds for the planting season. The profit he makes will help him improve his financial status. 

Jackson’s dream is to see his farming practice expand to greater levels. This is his second loan.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds for the planting season.

loans.name: Melkyanus

texts.en:
Melkyanus is a 28-year-old-man who is married to Femi, a 21-year-old lady. They are blessed with a 2-year-old baby girl named Zena. Melkyanus is an agricultural product supplier. He usually buys various agricultural products from farmers such vegetables, tomatoes, chilies, fruit, etc. to be sold at the market in town. He also sells agricultural products that are harvested from the farm belonging to his father-in-law, such as tomatoes, chilies and cabbages. He is grateful for his father-in-law allowing him to cultivate on his farm.

Melkyanus is planning to sell more agricultural products and therefore seeking a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. Melkyanus has already received a loan from TLM and had a good record in repaying the loan. He would like to spend the loan on seedlings of cabbage, tomato, chili, mustard greens, and fertilizer and disinfectant.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings of cabbage, tomato, chili, mustard greens, and fertilizer and disinfectant.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has one daughter who is 1 year old. She describes herself as ambitious.

Lucy operates a retail store where she sells cereals such as beans, maize, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a conducive business environment. She describes her biggest business challenge as being able to afford the high cost of cereals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cereals for selling. 

Lucy's dream is to sell cereals wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more cereals for selling.

loans.name: Jeselyn

texts.en:
Jeselyn is a very determinated and hardworking mother. Jeselyn is 31 years old. She is from the Sta. Victoria province of Isabela. 

Jeselyn is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional products such as drinks, bread, spices and coffee for her small store. 

Jeselyn hopes to arrange her store so it is more convenient for her customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, bread, spices and coffee for her store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, a 32-year-old single mother of a 13-year-old girl, lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

For the past three years, Jane has operated a vegetable-selling business from her home, retailing to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major business challenge of seasonality, and dreams of establishing a stall to sell her products from in the future.

Having joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business, with the Kshs 20,000 loan she is requesting Jane wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables, potatoes and onions.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Gladys Margot

texts.es: Gladys de 50 años vive ( duran Ecuador ) . ella empezó su negocio hace 10 años con la venta de zapatos . al ver que le iba bien decidió viajar al extranjero y traer mercadería de alla . trabaja todos los días con mucho esfuerzo y ganas sola . la dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia . a futuro ella anhela tener un local grande donde ponga su mercadería . con el préstamo comprara ( zapatos ropa ).
texts.en: Gladys is 50 years old and she lives in Duran, Ecuador. 10 years ago she started her business selling shoes, and since things were going well she decided to go abroad to buy some new products there. She works alone every day with great enthusiasm and effort, and criminality the main problem she has to face. In the future she wish to have a big shop were to sell her products. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy shoes and clothes.

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy, a 39-year-old mother of three children, all of whom attend school, lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Dorothy has operated a water-selling stall, retailing to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major business challenge of competition, and dreams of expanding and opening other outlets in the future.

With the requested Kshs 20,000 loan, Dorothy wants to purchase a water tank for storage of the water she sells. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank to store water for sale.

loans.name: Hafswa

texts.en:
Hafswa is a twenty-eight-year-old married woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling food from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food operators in the area. Hafswa dreams of expanding and employing more employees in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and chicks.

loans.name: Helala

texts.en:
Helala is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Hisham appears in her Kiva profile photo. The photo is taken next to his taxi.

Helala is a thirty-seven-year-old woman. She is married and has no children yet. Her husband has been a taxi driver for twelve years which is a profitable project.

Helala is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a new engine for the taxi and making some necessary repairs to it such as changing the tires and the mats. By taking this loan, Helala will help her husband to repair his taxi which is the only source of income for the family. This will improve the taxi's condition for the better and will enable Helala's husband to work extra hours and increase the family's income. 

About this loan product:
