Furkat is requesting a loan in the amount of $3000.  He intends to buy three heads of bulls to increase working capital.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Livia Violeta

texts.es:
LIVIA VIOLETA tiene 51 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 25, 22 y 15 años de edad en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, los socios se dedican la mayor parte de su tiempo en la agricultura, siembra de maíz y crianza de animales.

LIVIA VIOLETA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, mora, tomate , fréjol,. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas de tomate, fréjol, insumos, abonos, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas. Las compras y las ventas lo hará en Chillanes  cada semana.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar los cultivos.  Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es pagar el crédito con puntualidad.

En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar,  realizar minga los días domingos. Y disfrutar de las fiestas de la Virgen de la Inmaculada.
texts.en:
Livia Violeta, 51, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children who are 25, 21 and 15 years old in Chillanes, Bolívar Province.

The “Virgen de Baños” communal bank is composed of the Cerritos Mama Sara community.  The members spend most of their time farming, growing corn and raising animals.

Livia Violeta grows corn, blackberries, tomatoes and broad beans.  She’s asking for the loan to buy tomato and broad bean seeds, supplies, manure, fertilizer, urea and insecticide.  She will make her purchases and her sales weekly in Chillanes.

With help from the loan she will be able to improve the crops.  The challenge she faces is to repay the loan punctually.  In her free time she likes to rest, to do communal work on Sundays and to enjoy the feast of the Immaculate Conception.

loans.use: to buy tomato and broad bean seeds, manure, fertilizer, urea and insecticide.

loans.name: Flor Liduvina

texts.es:
Flor Liduvina tiene  54 años  es casada tiene cuatro hijos, vive  con el esposo y con los hijos de 30, 28, 22 y 20 años de edad en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, los socios se dedican la mayor parte de su tiempo en la agricultura, siembra de maíz y crianza de animales.
Flor Liduvina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, mora, tomate. Solicita el crédito para comprar  abonos, fertilizantes, urea, semillas de tomate y mora. Las compras y las ventas lo hará en Chillanes  cada semana.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá cultivar fréjol, mora, tomate y maíz sin ningún tipo de plagas.  Los desafíos es superar los problemas económicos.
El sueño es poder  ver que los hijos adquieran una profesión, mejorar la producción e incrementar los ingresos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión, disfrutar de las fiestas de la Inmaculada concepción.
texts.en:
Flor Liduvina, 54, is married and has four children.  She lives with her husband and children who are 30, 28, 22 and 20 years old in Chillanes, Bolívar Province.

The “Virgen de Baños” communal bank is composed of the Cerritos Mama Sara community.  The members spend most of their time farming, growing corn and raising animals.

Flor Liduvina farms corn, blackberries, tomatoes and broad beans.  She’s asking for the loan to buy tomato and blackberry seeds, manure, fertilizer and urea.  She will make her purchases and her sales weekly in Chillanes. With help from the loan she will be able to grow broad beans, blackberries, tomatoes and corn infestation-free.  

The challenge she faces is to overcome economic problems.  Her dream is to see her children attain professional status in the future and to improve and increase income.  In her free time she likes to watch television and to enjoy the feast of the Immaculate Conception.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, urea and tomato and blackberry seeds.

loans.name: Pastor Jesus

texts.es: Pastor de 60 años vive ( Guasmo  Guayaquil ). El decidió entrar a este negocio porque quería ayudar en la situación económica de su familia .  la idea de poner una tienda es de su esposa lo hizo y le va bien . Trabaja todos los días solo. tiene hijos menores . La dificultad que tiene es  la delincuencia. A  futuro el anhela mejorar su negocio y tener un  local. Con el préstamo comprara (aceite arroz)
texts.en: Pastor, 60, lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil.  He decided to go into this business because he wanted to help his family’s economic situation.  The idea of opening a store was his wife’s and he did so and is doing well.  He works alone every day.  He has minor children.  The difficulty he has is crime.  In the future he’d like to improve his business and have a locale.  He will use the loan to buy oil and rice.

loans.use: to buy rice and oil.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio de 30 años vive ( isla Guayaquil  ) el empezó a trabajar en 4 talleres de mecánica y aprendió mucho de carros haciendo mantenimiento . por lo cual decidió entrar a un curso de mecánica y ahora se puso su propio taller y le va bien . trabaja todos los días solo y a veces lo ayuda un primo es soltero . la dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia . a futuro el anhela tener su negocio grande . con el préstamo comprara ( piesas mecanicas ).
texts.en: Julio, 30, lives in Isla, Guayaquil.  He started working in four auto shops and learned a lot about servicing cars.  Because of this he decided to take an auto mechanics course and now he’s opened his own shop and is doing very well.  He works alone every day and sometimes his cousin helps.  He’s single.  The difficulty he has is crime.  In the future he’d like to enlarge his business.  He will use the loan to buy auto parts.

loans.use: to buy auto parts.

loans.name: Manuela  Antonia

texts.es: Manuela Antonia tiene 32 años de edad, tiene un hijo que está todavía a su cargo y como mucho esfuerzo lo ha sacado adelante. Manuela Antonia trabaja como docente en un colegio de la comunidad, ella tiene una vivienda que su mayor sueño es  acondicionarla y por falta de dinero no las ha realizado. Manuela Antonia está solicitando financiamiento para comprar materiales y realizar las mejoras a su vivienda lo cual comprara cemento, arena, piedrín, y otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Manuela Antonia, 32, has a son still in her care and with much effort she’s moved him ahead.  Manuela Antonia works as a teacher in a local school.  She has a house and her greatest dream is to fix it up but because of lack of money has been unable to do so.  Manuela Antonia is asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies to improve her house.  She will buy cement, sand, gravel and other building supplies.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Rosmery Albertina

texts.es: La Sra. Rosmery tiene 33 años y es soltera no tiene hijos, Se dedica a la venta de ropa en una zona muy comercial de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Rosmery  utilizara  este préstamo de para comprar  mercadería ropa por mayor  para su negocio, la Sra. Rosmery  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que en el lugar  hay mucha competencia de variedad  de mercadería y siempre esta constantemente con retos. Va a utilizar los beneficios incrementara su capital de trabajo,  sueña para su negocio es tener mas clientes y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, la Sra. se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosmery is 33 years old, single, and has no children. She sells clothing in a commercial district in the city of La Paz. This loan is her first transaction with Emprender and will be used to buy merchandise in bulk for her business. Sra. Rosmery faces challenges in her business since there is plenty of competitors who offer a variety of merchandise, so she must constantly deal with them. By utilizing the benefits of this loan, she will be able to increase her working capital.

Rosmery dreams of having more customers for her business and improving her income. She feels pleased and is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mendgul

texts.en:
Mendgul is a 38-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in Bayan-Ulgii province in Western Mongolia. Two of her children study in the secondary school. Her husband is the assistant driver of a bus and, in addition, started selling cars in 2010. 

Mendgul makes traditional clothes and souvenir products and trades them. The business has been profitable but they need a specific amount of finance (credit) to develop the business. Mendgul is a good-natured woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity to improve the household and save for my three sons' future. I think this business is being better than previous."  The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy cars for her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy cars to sell

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Yun, 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is employed in a sanitation company and earns approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is a security guard and earns about USD 3 per day. Due to the difficulty of the family’s transportation, Yun is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike to use to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to run a new business selling clothes in the market and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she plans to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Zoila Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila es socia del banco comunal La Merced, vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana ubicada al sureste de Cuenca, es de clima frió y desde su parque central se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales,  a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad.

Doña Zoila tiene 33 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad que están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo su camioneta realizando fletes, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de familiares.

La Señora Zoila se encuentra muy bien en la salud al igual que todos los miembros que conforman su familia. Ella labora en una panadería hace 15 años y también tiene una tienda de comestibles hace 4 años, actividades que ha elegido para mejorar el bienestar de sus hijos y mejorar la economía de su hogar.
 
Con el dinero de su crédito anterior compro productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda, en el pago de dicho crédito no tuvo ningún problema y realizo todos los pagos a la fecha. Esta pidiendo nuevo crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para ampliar su tienda. La banca comunal le gusta ya que los créditos son rápidos y existe un gran compañerismo en el grupo.
 
Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Zoila is a member of the “La Merced” communal bank.  She lives in Santa Ana Parish located in southeast Cuenca.  Its climate is cold and from its central park one can view a great part of the city of Cuenca.  Its residents raise animals, farm and many of them have jobs in the city.

Zoila is 33 years old, married and has two children who are 10 and 8 years old and attending the local little elementary school.  Her husband is a driver and works driving his truck making deliveries.  They do not have a house of their own but live in a house belonging to relatives.

Zoila is in very good health as well as the other members of her family.  She has been working in a bakery for 15 years and she also has had a grocery store for the last four years.  She chose these activities to improve her children’s wellbeing and to improve her home’s economy.

With the money from her previous loan she bought basic staple items to stock her store and had no problems repaying the loan; she made all her payments on time.  She’s asking for a new loan to buy building materials and supplies to enlarge her store.  

She likes the communal bank because the loans are quick and there is a great deal of team spirit in the group.  Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Juan Matias

texts.es: El Sr. Juan tiene 43 años y es divorciado con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de 19 años, el se dedica a  la carpintería, el Sr. Juan es carpintero hace varios años, su taller se encuentran en la zona de Cobol,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, Juan utilizara este préstamo para la compra de madera y otros materiales para su negocio ya que tiene mucho trabajo que realizar por esta  razón  solicita este préstamo es por la gran demanda de roperos, Juan enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la gran competencia  y los  problemas sociales, y  utilizara los beneficios para incrementar su producción de muebles, su deseo para su negocio es tener una carpintería grande con muchos operarios en la cual pueda producir muebles por cantidades, el Sr. Juan es una persona emprendedora con ganas de superación se siente feliz por la oportunidad que la institución le brinda.
texts.en:
Juan, 43, is divorced and has a 19 year old son.  He’s a carpenter.  Juan’s has been a carpenter for many years and his workshop is located in the Cobol zone.  

This loan is his third sequence within the institution and Juan will use it to buy lumber and other supplies for his business because he has much work to do and this is why he’s asking for the loan because of the large number of armoires in demand.  

The challenge Juan faces in his business is much competition and societal problems and he will use the benefits to increase furniture production.  His wish is to have a large carpentry shop with many employees that he can manufacture furniture in quantity in.  J

uan is an enterprising person with a strong wish to improve; he feels happy for the opportunity the institution is providing him.

loans.use: to buy lumber and other supplies.

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en: Voeurn, 55, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries and firewood for over three years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a marriage broker who earns approximately USD 2 per day. Three of her children are employed: two are construction workers and one is a creel (basket) maker. Due to the difficulty of the family’s transportation, Voeurn is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike to use for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger to provide enough space for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Kha

texts.en: Kha, 34, is married and resides with his wife and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has been running a business of buying cattle to resell for over seven years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. His wife runs a souvenir and clothes shop. She earns approximately USD 7 per day. In order to improve his wife’s business, Kha is requesting a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase more fashionable clothes to sell. This loan would enable his wife to have more fashionable clothes to attract more customers and earn more profit. In the future, he would like to use the profits to expand the business and help his children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, he hopes to rebuild his present house to make it comfortable for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more fashionable clothes to sell

loans.name: Bellavista  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Bellavista está formada por 6 socias y 1 socio quienes son personas amables, gentiles y muy trabajadoras, laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten solventar  los gastos de sus hogares y salir en adelante con sus familias. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar que es de clima frió, está rodeado de vegetación, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y comercio, muchos diariamente laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca diferentes ocupaciones. Su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa, tiene 35 años, es divorciada en su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija de 13 años que estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad. 

La Señora. Rosa se dedica a  los quehaceres de su hogar y cuidar de su hija, labora vendiendo leche actividad que la realiza hace 3 años y  de domingo a domingo, también en su casa cría cuyes, pollos, ganado y cerdos.  Se dedica a la agricultura y lo que produce  es solo para consumo de su hogar.
 
Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra un becerro para seguir creciendo en la cría de animales.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados. 

Las dos niñas de la foto son hijas de dos de las socias.
texts.en:
The “Bellavista” communal bank has one male and six female members who are pleasant, kind, very hardworking people who work at various activities to cover household expenses and get ahead with their children.    They live around Cumbe Parish in Cuenca, a place with a cold climate surrounded by vegetation.  Its residents raise animals, farm and are merchants.  Many of them go to work every day in the city of Cuenca in various jobs.  Its residents maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.

One of the members of this group is Rosa.  She’s 35 years old, divorced and has a 13 year old daughter attending a secondary school in the city.  The house she lives in is her property.

Rosa does her household chores and takes care of her daughter.  She has been working selling milk for the last three years from Sunday to Sunday.  She also raises guinea pigs, chickens, cattle and pigs at home.  She also farms but only for home consumption.

She’s in the second loan with the communal bank and she will use it to buy a calf to continue raising animals.  Her goal is to finish her house since it still needs some finishing touches.

The two little girls in the photo are the daughters of two of the members.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Salmun

texts.en:
Salmun, 59 years old, is married to Yohana, a 58-year-old lady. They have eight children between 22 and 33 years old.

Even though Salmun has a job as a teacher, he spends his spare time running a kiosk business in order to generate more income for his family. The business is located about 10 km from his residence. 

Salmun provides corn, tamarind seed, rice, instant noodle, vegetables etc at his kiosk. Salmun is happy for this business, which enables him to finance his four children who are still at the university. Salmun would like to complete his kiosk with more stocks. Therefore, he is seeking a loan of IDR 5,000,000 to purchase rice, corn and tamarind seeds etc.

loans.use: to purchase rice, corn and tamarind seeds

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: MARIA DE 57 años vive ( Guasmo  Guayaquil ). Ella decidió entrar a este negocio porque quería ayudar en la situación económica de su familia .  la idea de poner una tienda es de su conyugue  lo hizo y le va bien . Trabaja todos los días solo. tiene hijos menores . La dificultad que tiene es  la delincuencia. A  futuro el anhela mejorar su negocio y tener un  local. Con el préstamo comprara (aceite, arroz, bebidas, snacks)
texts.en: At 57 years old, Maria lives in Guasmo Guayaquil.  She decided to enter this business because she wanted to help the financial situation of her family.  The idea of opening a store was her spouse's, and she did so and it is going well.  She works alone every day.  She has young children.  The difficulty she has is crime.  In the future she wishes to improve her business and have a site for it.  With the loan she will buy oil, rice, drinks, and snacks.

loans.use: to buy rice, snacks, and drinks.

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Hing, 27, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a construction foreman for more than three years, earning approximately 10 USD per day. His wife is employed in a massage shop and earns about 3 USD per day. Due to the family's difficulty with transportation, Hing is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable him to use the money saved on transportation expenses for the family's needs. In the future, he would like to expand his business and help his children get their bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, he plans to rebuild his present house to make it convenient for his family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Thy, 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been employed as sanitation workers for over eight years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Thy wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, Thy is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase timber for constructing her house. This loan would enable her to have a comfortable house for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to build her house

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey, 40, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a truck driver who earns approximately USD 15 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Srey would like to run a new business. Therefore, Srey is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase groceries to sell in order to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the further profits to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to repair some parts of her house.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty  de 50 años  vive en el municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposo y tiene 2  hijos en las edades de 22 y 25 años.  Ella tiene una tienda  donde vende ranchos, víveres, refrescos y artículos de la canasta familiar. Su actividad la inició hace 5 años,  como un pequeño negocio donde vendía pocos artículos, como tubérculos y leguminosas. A ella le empezó a ir muy bien,  porque iniciaron la construcción de 2 urbanizaciones cercanas,  que se convirtieron en su oportunidad empresarial para crecer. En la actualidad planea aumentar el surtido y comprar en mayor volumen y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará abarrotes, tubérculos, refrescos, leguminosas y en general articulo de la canasta familiar, que son los que compra su clientela diariamente, al detalle  para elaborar la comida de su familia. Su meta es fortalecer su buen nombre, ofreciendo un buen servicio, mercancía a precios competitivos y con ello muy seguramente logrará que su negocio sea  cada vez más sostenible.
texts.en:
Betty, 50, lives in the town of Soledad, fifteen minutes from the city of Barranquilla, with her husband; she has two children who are 22 and 25 years old.  She has a store where she sells snacks, foodstuffs, soft-drinks and basic staple items.

She started the business five years ago as a small store selling just a few items like tubers and greens.  She started to do well because two housing projects started to be built nearby and this became her opportunity for business growth.  

She is planning at present to increase her inventory and to buy in larger volume which is precisely the reason why she’s calling on her Kiva loan, the first financing she’s had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy groceries, tubers, soft-drinks, greens and basic staple items in general that her customers buy daily at retail to prepare the daily family meals.  

Her goal is to strengthen her good name offering good service and merchandise at competitive prices.  Surely with this she will succeed in making her business more sustainable each time.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, francisco es una persona luchadora ya que se ha dedicado a trabajar muy duro para que no le falte nada en su hogar, es una familia muy unida y trabajadora. Francisco inicio con un primo que fue quien le enseño a trabajar, luego decidió comenzar su propio negocio, el empezó a comprar leche para producir queso, y poco a poco ha ido creciendo y desde hace seis años inicio con la descremadora, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 5:00 pm. El préstamo que solicita Francisco lo necesita para la compra de leche para elaborar queso. Con este préstamo cambiaria la vida de Francisco en gran manera ya que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para comprar la mercadería necesaria para elaborar el producto y así poder ofrecerles mas queso a sus clientes. El único problema que ha tenido fue una vez que lo asaltaron y perdió mucho dinero y eso le afecto en su negocio, ya que se quedo sin capital para trabajar e invertirlo en la producción del queso. Una de sus metas es que su negocio pueda crecer y así poder sacar adelante a su familia. Es su cuarto crédito en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Francisco is 33 years old, married, and has two children. His wife takes care of the household duties. Francisco is a determined individual who works very hard so that his household lacks nothing. His family is very close and works hard. Francisco started working when a cousin taught him this trade. He later decided to start his own business. Francisco began by purchasing milk for producing cheese. His business grew a little bit at a time with the milk separator he acquired when he started six years ago. Francisco works from 6am to 5pm.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy milk for making cheese. This loan will change Francisco's life in a major way since he does not have enough money to buy the necessary supplies for making his product. As a result, he will have more cheese to offer to his customers. The problem he has had to face was being the victim of a robbery in which he lost a great deal of money, which affected his business. Francisco was left without any working capital to invest in cheese production. One of his goals is to grow his business so that he can move his family forward.

This is his fourth loan with FAMA and his previous loans were repaid on time.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Yerson Enrique

texts.es: Yerson de 37 años vive con su cónyuge y 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 8 años. El tiene un negocio familiar donde elabora rulos de diferentes tamaños en  malla  metálica, oficio del que deriva el sustento de su familia y  que aprendió por tradición,  pues su padre también lo practicaba  y yerson lo ayudaba. Así fue que cuando estuvo preparado, dio curso libre a su aptitud emprendedora e inició de manera independiente su propio negocio. En su actividad es ayudado activamente por su cónyuge y ambos tienen el sueño de comercializar estos productos en otros países y el de tener casa propia, por eso se esmeran en hacer crecer su microempresa. Sus rulos son comercializados en algunos almacenes de la ciudad de Barranquilla especializados en belleza y tambien en las ciudades costeras de Santa marta, Riohacha y el municipio de Maicao. En la actualidad Yerson está  aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas para elaborar  rulos, inversión que proyecta ser muy exitosa,  porque s sus productos tienen una buena demanda en el mercado de la belleza, que será respondida con gran experiencia por Yerson.
texts.en:
Yerson, 37, lives with his spouse and three children whose ages range from 1 to 8 years.  He has a family business where he manufactures metal mesh curlers in various sizes, an occupation that allows him to support his family and that he learned through tradition since his father did the same thing and Yerson would help him.

This was how when he was sufficiently prepared he let his enterprising spirit run loose and started his own business.  His spouse helps him actively with his work and they both dream with selling these products in other countries and with having their own house.  This is why they strive to make their micro business grow.  He sells his curlers to stores in Barranquilla that specialize in beauty supplies and also in the coastal cities of Santa Marta, Rioacha and in the municipality of Maicao.  

Yerson is applying for a Kiva loan now, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he will use to buy raw materials needed to manufacture the curlers.  The investment looks to be very successful because his products are in high demand in the beauty market and with his great experience Yerson will respond to it.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make metal mesh curlers.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Yon, 52, is widowed and resides with her two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a chef in a restaurant. She earns approximately USD 5 per day. One of her children is employed in a hotel and earns about USD 3 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Yon is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her son to run a public transportation service (motor taxi). This purchase would enable her son to generate extra income to support her family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son's business

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is 29 years old and is married to Nova. The couple is thankful, because they have been blessed with two children. Noel is involved in buying and selling fish in the local community. He wants to buy different kinds of fish to sell, but he lacks the necessary capital. Because of this, Noel is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy "tilapia" and milk fish to sell. He believes that the loan will help him to increase his income. He is hoping that he will earn a higher income to support his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy "tilapia" and milk fish to sell

loans.name: Blanca Josefina

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca es socia del banco comunal La Merced, vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana ubicada al sureste de Cuenca, es de clima frió y desde su parque central se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales,  a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad. 

Doña Blanca tiene 46 años, es divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de los que dos son casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijas solteras trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. La casa en la que vive es arrendada.
 
La Señora. Blanca tiene un Kiosco en donde vende comida, pollos y cuyes asados al carbón, actividad en la que se encuentra hace 3 años y trabaja de lunes a domingo todo el día.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 7 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en una vajilla, una carpa para su local y víveres para la preparación de sus productos.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca is a member of the Communal Bank "La Merced" and lives in the parish of Santa Ana, which is located in southeast Cuenca. The weather is cold and a tremendous view of the city of Cuenca can be seen from the central park. The people earn their living by raising animals, farming, and taking many jobs in the city.

Doña Blanca is 46 years old, divorced, and has four children. Two of them are married and live independently. Her two single daughters work and help her financially. The house in which she lives is rented.

Sra. Blanca has a kiosk where she sell food and barbecued chicken and guinea pigs. She has been in business for three years and works all day, Monday through Sunday. Blanca has been with her Communal Bank for seven years and her new loan will be invested in dishes, a tent for her kiosk, and supplies for preparing her products. Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy a tent, dishes, and supplies.

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en: Hoeurn, 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been employed as sanitation workers for over nine years, earning approximately 5 USD per day. Due to the family’s transportation difficulties, Hoeurn is requesting a loan of 300 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the money she saves on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to breed pigs to generate more income to support the family and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: Adriana es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras, tiene 59 años, es madre de 8 hijos, antes ella solo se dedicaba a la venta de cereales, ella aprendió con Finca a poder trabajar y con mucha constancia ahora tiene una empresa de lavado y engrase y una tienda de abarrotes, en la tienda le va muy bien, agradece mucho a Finca porque le ayudaron a tener una visión de las cosas que deseaba tener. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de productos para su negocio y lubricantes.
texts.en: Adriana is a member of Banco Comunal Palmeras, she is 59, and the mother of 8.  She used to sell cereals, and gained work experience through Finca.  She now runs a car wash and oil change service, as well as a general store, which has been very prosperous.  She is grateful to Finca for the support given, which has helped her to realize and achieve her goals.  She plans to invest this loan in products for her store and oil lubricants.

loans.use: to buy oil lubricants

loans.name: Saida Alicia

texts.es: Saida es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras, tiene 25 años, no tienen hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años, se dedica a la venta de ceviche, le gusta mucho las capacitaciones que recibe por que le ayudan a  evaluarse como persona, valorarse, y aprender a como administrar su negocio y no sobreendeudarse, valora mucho la confianza que le dieron porque le ayuda a salir adelante con su negocio, gracias a ello pudo compra un terreno en Vilcas donde sembró quinua y ahora el préstamo lo invertirá para la cosecha de la quinua.
texts.en: Saida is a member of Banco Comunal Palmeras, and is 25 with no children.  She has been involved with Finca Perú for 4 years, and sells ceviche.  She enjoys the training opportunities as they help to evaluate and learn how to run a business and avoid indebtedness.  She is grateful for the trust offered, which has helped her grow her business.  Thanks to her success, she has bought a plot of land in Vilcas where she planted quinua; she will invest this credit in the quinua harvest.

loans.use: to harvest Quinoa (grain)

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras, estuvo hace 9 años atrás en FINCA Perú, lo dejo un tiempo a causa de un robo que tuvo, pero su perseverancia la hizo salir adelante y volvió a Finca, ahora se dedica a la confección de centros, llicllas, blusas de Huamanguina, ella aprendió la puntualidad, como educar a sus hijos y ser mas responsable, al venir a sus reuniones se siente muy bien porque hizo en su Bancomunal muy buenas amigas. Ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de telas en rollos.
texts.en: Irma is a member of Banco Comunal Palmeras, and was involved in FINCA Perú 9 years ago, but was forced to halt her activity due to a theft.  But through perseverance, she was able to overcome her difficulties and return as a member of  Finca.  She now makes clothing items such as Huamanguina blouses.  She has learned punctuality, how to educate her children and take responsibility.  She enjoys group meetings very much and has made friends in Bancomunal.  She plans to use this credit to buy rolls of cloth.

loans.use: buy rolls of cloth

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is hard-working and a loving father to seven children. He is 46 years old and married. His current priority in life is to give his children the opportunity to finish their studies and achieve their life goals. His family's primary source of income is his corn field and retail store. Jimmy is grateful that he is able to run and operate his two businesses, despite the difficulties and pain he has experienced.

Jimmy is a simple man who aims to educate all his children and improve their way of life. Since he started borrowing additional capital from ASKI, he has been able to obtain greater income, which solely serves to benefit his family. Jimmy repaid his previous loan and asks for more capital in the amount of 10,000 PHP. This loan will be use to buy more fish, meat, vegetables, and ingredients to restock his retail stall. He believes that his goals will be realized and that he will be successful in life and business.

loans.use: to buy more meat, fish, vegetables, and ingredients for his retail stall.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is from the village of Rang-ay. She is 39 years old and sells fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 250 PHP a day.

She is now requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase different kinds of fish, such as milk fish and tilapia, to resell. She hopes that her business will further grow, and she hopes to uplift her family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish, such as milk fish and tilapia, to resell.

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
Cora is a helpful mother of one and a wife to Jose. Despite her disability, she assists her husband in generating an income for the family by managing a small store just in front of their house. In business for four years, she earns about P200 daily, an income that really helps offset the bills at home.

Cora would like to sell more products to earn more income, and so is requesting a loan of P7,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, detergent, soap and shampoo to sell in her store. She hopes to progressively assist her family in achieving a higher standard of living and provide the best education possible for her child.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, detergent, soap and shampoo to sell in her store.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es: Abigail es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre de un hijo, se dedica la venta de verduras, pescado y queso para llevar a la Selva, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 9 años, gracias a las capacitaciones Abigail pudo conducir bien su hogar y ser mejor persona, también le ayudó a poder educar a su único hijo, ella puede ver que sus ganancias han crecido notablemente y eso le llena de mucha satisfacción, que su trabajo y su constancia esta dando resultados. Ahora con el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de verduras y demás cosas para llevar a la Selva.
texts.en: Abigail is a member of Banco Comunal Palmeras.  She is 45, has one son, and works selling vegetables, fish and cheese to communities in the forest.  She has been involved with FINCA Perú for 9 years, and thanks to the training offered, Abigail manages her household and personal life better, also helping to educate her only child.  She has seen her earning increase markedly, and this satisfies her greatly as she sees the results of her work and discipline. She plans to invest this credit to buy vegetables and other items to sell in the forest.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in the forest

loans.name: Donatilda

texts.es: Donatilda es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 7 hijos, es casada, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 8 años, todo este tiempo pudo aprender como administrar su negocio, se dedica la venta de leña y huevo de codorniz, gracias a los préstamos ella pudo tener mas ganancias y mejoró su casa, pudo educar a sus hijos, agradece porque ayudan a las mujeres de bajos recursos económicos, y les enseñan como trabajar. Ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de leña.
texts.en: Donatilda is a member of Banco Comunal Palmeras; she is 48, the mother of 7, and married.  She has been involved with Finca Perú for 8 years, and has learned much about running her business.  She sells firewood and quail eggs, and thanks to prior credits she has increased her income and improved her housing as well as providing education for her children.  She is grateful for the help to poor women and the courses on how to work better. She plans to use this credit to buy firewood.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, age 37, raises hogs in the village of Libag Sur. She is married to a construction worker, and they have three children attending school. Together, they work untiringly to generate income for their children's education and sustenance. She would like to improve her small business, so she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs to help them grow healthier.

In the future, Teresita would like to make her busines grow for the overall betterment of her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Crislyn

texts.en:
Crislyn raises and fattens pigs for future sale. She and her husband John live in the village of Libag Sur. Crislyn is now 21 years old and has two young children, one of whom is attending primary school. 

Crislyn would like to ensure the healthy growth of her hogs so that she can sell them at higher cost upon distribution. This will help increase the income acquired from her business. Therefore, Crislyn is asking for a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy medicine, feed, and vaccines for her hogs. 

With the profits from the business, she will continue to provide a good education for her children and will lead them to a progressive way of life someday.

loans.use: to buy medicine, feed, and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo, 27 years old, lives in the village of Libag Sur with his wife Maria and their child. To generate an income, Rodolfo raises hogs to fatten and sell, and also works part-time on a construction site. Rodolfo earns about P3,000 each month in construction and P2,500 whenever he sells a raised hog.

Now requesting a loan of P9,000 to buy both an additional piglet to raise and feed to sustain it, Rodolpho promises to repay on time. In the future, he hopes to achieve a stable income for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy both an additional piglet to raise and feed to sustain it.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice, a 32-year-old married mother of one child, sells dried fish to the people in her village. She has been patiently offering her products on a house-to-house basis for over four years now.

To increase her sales capacity, Janice is requesting a loan of P7,000 to purchase additional dried fish. In the future, she would like to establish a stall from which to sell her products. Janice is praying for her family's good health and a good relationship with her customers with the goal of generating continuous income from her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Maïmouna est une femme mariée, mère de 7 enfants. Elle exerce un commerce de produits cosmétiques, de Bijoux et de colliers.Elle achète ses produits en gros et les revend au détails soit à crédit ou au comptant.
Ce commerce lui a permis d'améliorer ses revenus et de prendre ainsi en charge une bonne partie de ses besoins. Elle parvient à soutenir également son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses alimentaires de la famille. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des lait de beauté, des mèches pour tresses, des bijoux et des colliers. Elle a comme ambition de s'engager dans l'importation de cosmétique.
texts.en:
Maïmouna is married and the mother of seven children. She sells cosmetic products, necklaces and other jewellery. She buys her products wholesale and resells them to individuals, who buy using cash or on credit. 

Maïmouna's business has increased her income and covers a large part of her living expenses. She also supports her husband in paying for their family's food. In order to bolster her business, she is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs to buy beauty lotions, highlights for hair, necklaces and other jewellery. Her ambition is to start importing beauty products.

loans.use: to buy beauty lotions, highlights for hair, necklaces and other jewellery.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito has been a "tricycle" operator for over 10 years now. He is patiently doing this to earn an income for the sustenance of his family. He is 41 years old, married and has two children. 

Carlito usually earns about P250 a day by providing the motorcycle service. Income from the business goes for meals and allowances for his children. He is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy crude oil and side mirrors for the motorcycle. 

Carlito would like to keep ensuring safe travel for his passengers and also generate good profit from the business.

loans.use: to buy crude oil and side mirrors for the motorcycle
